description:
I remember the good old days when sand filled the floors of this tiki bar on Broadway. So many good memories of post-work happy hours over flaming volcano bowls but it's still just as fun today. 

The sand is now long gone but the good time remain. Pick a tiki drink from a pretty wide list. It's kitschy but a fun vibe. Get there early to get space in the cozy back area for larger groups. Spirited bartenders round out the experience. 

SF probably has the most tiki bars that I've ever seen in one city but Bamboo Hut is also like a neighborhood bar - albeit with lots of colorful tropical flair.
author: Jon L.

description: Planned to go to Bamboo Hut.  Got there at 5:07 pm. On a Saturday. Closed.  Need to update there hours. $10 Lyft ride wasted.  Maybe next time.
author: Tony M.

description: Bambooo hut was one of my all time favorite places. Recently it seems they started charging a $5 cover to enter. Thanks a lot management for ruining a good thing. You're going to lose more customers not wanting to pay 5 dollars to go into a half empty bar than you'll gain.  I hope they rethink this policy
author: Joe B.

description:
It's not upscale but it's so welcoming.  It's divey tiki bar with bras hanging above the bar.   Killer volcano drinks and great dj music weekend nights.  You don't have to dress up and people don't care what you wear or do here.  Just have fun and enjoy the vibe.  

I have been coming here for several years and always bring different friends.   Cover is at most$5 and only after 10pm on weekends.   It's one of our go to places as a local for good strong drinks and fun atmosphere.
author: Lei H.

description: Their food here is amazing! I'm very health conscious and I love their Japanese influenced section. Everything here is fantastic and I wish one was in the sunset so I could here on weekends!
author: Katrina B.

description:
Bamboo Hut was one of the first tiki themed dive bar that I've ever seen.  It wasn't that crowded although they did have a DJ playing music in the background.

The drinks were cheaper as expected for dive bar establishments and two bartenders handled the entire room with attitude and frequent screams of joy and the occasional shot drank.  One of them in particular that took my drink order was the epitome of FIERCE.  She had tattoos, dyed hair, and a personality to match.  For people like that who try hard and enjoy their job, those people I don't mind tipping a little bit extra.

Enjoyed my time for the brief moments that I was here.
author: Ben H L.

description:
This place is really small so there's not much room to sit especially if you come in a large group. They have one semi-private room in the back which sits a large group but if that's taken, there's only smaller tables.

Music here was really chill and the staff were all very friendly! I really liked all the mixed drinks here (plus they have fun names).
author: Cassie Z.

description: So much fun, such good fun drinks!!! Blender drinks in a Tiki bar! Olivia is a great bartender who treats you to the funniest drinking in town!
author: Douglas A.

description: Since I do not go clubbing and socialize anymore I did not know were to go on a Thursday night. We were looking everywhere for a bar with good vibes and drinks and finally stumbled on this little gem. The dj played old school hip hop. The bartender was dope...a true mixologist.
author: Nicole G.

description:
While im not the demographic for this place - they do deliver on their brand. A tourist trap tikki bar with music.

They have an array of specialty drinks most of which heavily rely on sugar, cheap booze, and in quite a few cases fire - as decoration.

They have a DJ playing the music the crowd seems to enjoy.

Its worth a stop on a NB bar hop.
author: Oleg H.

description: Doors don't open next door until 10 pm because of a private party so we walked into here and  my gfs had their first drink. No cover charge. Spacious inside. Typical tiki bar. Good service and good drinks.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Came in with a group of coworkers around 6:30 pm on a Thursday - lots of people at the bar already, but plenty of room in the booths! 

Since I was hanging with a bunch of "work hard, drink harder" developers, I didn't really get a choice beyond the Volcano Bowls ($20 reg., $15 during happy hour) - I tried both the Strawberry *and* the Pineapple bowl, and I'll let you guess which one tastes like a delicious, sugar-filled Slurpee and which one tastes like a night of regrets (I ruined pineapple juice for myself sometime back in 2008). 

The bowls are to be shared by 3-4 people, and even then, are pretty alcoholic. This is not a good option for someone who likes to sit back with a glass of wine or quietly nurse a beer. This is a race to the finish. If you manage to drink the flaming 151 in the center, kudos to you. 

In the future, I'd love to try a pina colada, lava flow, or other one-serving cocktail. There's a great divey/tiki vibe going, and the bartenders are friendly and pour a strong drink. If you're in the area, and especially if you're with a group looking to get the night started quickly, check it out!
author: Laura B.

description:
This place is pretty ill yo! (ill = slag for cool) this is one of the few bars in North Beach that is trying to break away from the "Buy one get one" or "Come here and get a super overly strong drink and puke everywhere" vibe that a lot of bars in the North Beach area seem to have. This place is kinda..in a league of it's own so to speak. I'm talking about The Bamboo Hut. Let's get this review rollin!

The Bamboo Hut isn't a Dive Bar, it's not a Saloon or a Shishi Cosmo Lounge or anything like that. It's a festive, tropical almost like having a beer on a lounge chair in the sand next to the ocean kinda bar. As you enter, the decor would remind you of something that you may see on spring break with the possie. This place is really an indoor tiki lounge. Complete with a cabana, that's pretty dope if you ask me. The only thing missing is the hula girls and the fire dancers. This bar also has a huge Tiki head on the wall that will catch you off guard if you're the jumpy type. But its a cool add on to this bar. I hear they have a disk jockey on occasions and I think that's cool..me being one myself and all. I've been here a hand full of times and a great philosophy I've heard from someone is...."If they can make your favorite drink correctly, then that's a place you need to frequent" well in that case and amidst all their fancy and creative concoctions. 

The Bamboo Hut will remain on my top 3 list of bars I go too when in in North Beach (check my sf check ins for my other hotspots) They have a beavy of specialty drinks here, to be honest....I have yet to try some of them. But I've indeed had drinks like the ones they have posted. Check out my picks for the selections and the pricing. I'm a Gin and Tonic dude, and here the bartenders make a pretty good one ($6). But the bartenders are a bit..dull and very detached..at least on some of my visits I've had here. But other than that, this place is a pretty cool place to check out and have a drink @. If you're brave go for the ($12) "Volcano" I've seen people order it, I haven't gotten that brave yet ha!

In closing, this place is very cool and different than any bar you will go to in the North Beach neighborhood. Its refreshing to see something different in a town full of Cosmo Lounges, Saloons, Dive Bars and Pubs. The environment is festive and fun. It sits off Broadway and Kerney street..kinda Monroe Night Club and Hue Nightclub is nearby. This place is very hip and trendy and I could imagine with the dj there it's crankin. My review is one of a few, if you're in North Beach and want to try somewhere new. Come here and as always, Yelp your own experience.
author: Tre S.

description:
Dropped into the Bamboo Hut with some friends and fam. Doing a little day bar hopping. Festive, well decorated place that transports you to a tropical island tiki bar. 

Lots of drink specials, fun environment and great music. They were bumping lots Prince due to his recent passing and everyone had a great time. I'd go back and try some of their signature drinks at a later time when more party peeps are there. The strawberry volcano!!!
author: Antonio D. M.

description: Awesome bar.  Went here on halloween last year.  It's the only tiki bar that I know of near downtown (everything else is out near the Richmond).  It's a spacious bar with lot's of fun drink specials.
author: Greta R.

description: Had so much fun here-- but was probably cuz I was with a lit group. The decorations remind me of the enchanted tiki room in Disneyland, but with bras hanging over the bar (LOL). Shared one of their volcano drinks with four other people, definitely was a festive drink!
author: Cheechee L.

description:
Bring your island outfits!

This is a tiki themed bar located on Broadway near the night clubs and strip clubs. I'd recommend this place for a pre drink before starting your night. The place is quite small and has a couple tvs to watch sports.

The drinks are average and nothing special. They do have a couple cool bowls to share with a large group that light on fire such as the volcano bowl. The place also has some drink specials that are not too bad for the price. The portions are generous too.

I think I'll come by next time I'm in the area to get a quick buzz going!
author: Stephen C.

description: Interesting spot to drop by. Their volcano drink is awesome! Great to  come check out but nothing spectacular about this bar.
author: Lucky N.

description:
Been here once on a Saturday night. Had a group of 5 with me. There wasn't a lot of booth space since it was crowded of course but we ended up grabbing a booth. 

This place gave out a great vibe. Me and my friends shared two volcanoes. Our first one was the pineapple one. It tasted okay. Kind of strong actually. But it went by fast with our group. The second on we tried the strawberry volcano. I personally think this tasted better than the pineapple but was wayyy to sweet. I was thinking to ask for a mixed flavor one because one was strong with alcohol and the other one was sweet. It would have made a great balance. lol 

The volcanoes were $20 each. You can definitely share one with maybe 3-4 people. 5 people is pushing it. 

The music playing was old school and I liked it. It was a great place to sing loudly with your friends and have a good time. Which I did. =]
author: Samantha N.

description:
I have been to Bamboo Hut several times over the last 3 years and it has always been consistent. It's a great place to go to before heading out dancing or to more bars. 

Drinks: always good and always strong! We always have the volcano which is $20 but enough for 3-4 people. I recommend the strawberry flavor.  

Crowd: Questionable. That's all I can say. 

Music: I absolutely love the music, they play a great mix of classic hip hop, 80's, and top 40.
author: Natasha S.

description: Kind of a dive-y tiki bar. It was pretty empty on a Friday night (but this was 3 years ago). Get the Strawberry Volcano Bowl which lights on fire!
author: Christine C.

description:
This little treasure was the perfect way to end my extended layover in San Francisco. 

The Situation:

My connecting flight is cancelled heading east and I'm in SF for an extra 40 hours. It's a Tuesday so most people I know here can't meet up or hang out. After one friend does, but needs to jet early, he has Über cab drop me in North Beach for one last hurrah before I head back to my hotel. North Beach turns out to be full of strip clubs - I'm uninterested in that type of night - but a nearby dancer on the street is very helpful and sends me to Bamboo Hut. 

The Beginning:

I walk in and it's basically dead. However there is a super friendly, cool and chill bartender working. I sit down and I'm promptly served a potent cocktail and he easily engages in great conversation. He also so kindly allows me to charge my dying phone while I'm there. I had my hula hoop with me since I hooped in different areas all over SF during the day. Slowly people walk in and inquire about the pretty plastic circle I have with me. 

As the night goes on, various dancers from the nearby slew of strip clubs come in and out either hunting for business or with their clients for the night to party. Everyone is very sweet...and plenty of drinks are served, all very potent...and now....

The Party:

Basically, everyone is feeling it, in a good way. Stripper, client, guys night out, business men, then me...the only non dancer girl. We are dancing, singing, hula hooping (yes it ended up being the center of attention...show stealer...hmmmph) laughing, vibing, and just having a GREAT time. A fiery volcano is purchased for me, and while I couldn't finish most of it, it was quite the treat and like the other cocktails before it, potent! 

I partied like a brain damaged test monkey right up until close. Then the bartender and a local DJ ensured I was safe getting back to my hotel in Millbrae. 

Bamboo Hut: It's cheap, it's dark, it's friendly, it's fun and the drinks are strong. Puuuurfect. 

Now if only they could have cured my hangover on my flight the next day. Ugh...
author: Usagi T.

description:
I hate coconut and I guess I should have asked but there was no mention of coconut in the "bye felicia" on the board and the coconut flavor is so strong!!!! I'm so upset now I have to down an $8 drink I don't like. Something with a coconut flavor this strong should have at least a mention of it :( 

My wife got the chuckberry- we really like that one.

The waiter was AWESOME my wife described him as "backwards cap, cool lookin, I don't know?" and I agree!! He even told us when we asked that the "bye felicia" was originally without coconut so thats why its not on the menu!! PLS update!! went from 2 stars up to 3 stars just bc of this waiter I hope their admin gives him a raise he MADE our experience here.
author: Chessie C.

description:
Great place to chill.    The bathroom is a bit of a problem.
         THe door is busted so it doesn't lock and the door is kinda far from the toilet so its hard to keep the door shut and take one at the same time.

I am sure alot of people probably had moments where they had to sit on the toilet .
Idk how they do it, everyone probably has a different procedure.
I just usually jump real quick on it and hope by the time I am done no one comes in.
I've been lucky every time, whew oh well except once I think but I think I was pulling my pants up when the guy came up so he came just in time.
I don't think people really wanna see someone taking a dump anyway.

The area is nice and the decor is lovely.   They have a cool happy hour which I like .
Its pretty close to my favorite spots and its very dog friendly. 

I love the lighting .  

I am a big fan of there bowls.  Y'know me I'd rather drink a bowl them smoke one.
The volcano and pina colada are hella good 

The brain freeze is perfect, goes great with the buzz you get.

When all the other happy hours in the area are over this is my go to place .

I also love how sometimes the tiki God looks like he's gonna vomit.
author: Luke S.

description:
This place is sort of hilarious. It was pretty empty when we came by around 8:30pm on a Wednesday. Small bar with some booths a small back room. Pretty dark with island decorations. 

They had a happy hour special of $8 off their volcano drinks (big mixed drink - either pineapple or strawberry flavored - that's lit in the middle), which are only $20, so $12 for giant drink to share. We were a big group, so got three of them! They were pretty strong but tasted alright. 

I wouldn't rush back here, but wouldn't hate it if I had to come again.
author: MaryKate M.

description: Dope DJ's & strong drinks right on the strip. Every Second Saturday of the month is Bodyrock check it out!
author: Don D.

description:
Cheap drinks, good music, big booths, one helluva stanky bathroom and my friend Peter D in a sweet, sweet kimono. These are the things I remember about Bamboo Hut... And most of them are with fondness. 

We came here in a big group and were able to take over two booths and two Scorpion Bowls for $30 or less. Half of us tried to light our fingers on fire with the flaming 151 in the center and the other half watched in complete astonishment. If you're into tropical drinks and '90s gangsta rap, you'll be in heaven - seriously. 

For extra s's & g's, don't forget the kimono. It brings things to a whole other level, I promise.
author: Hilary H.

description:
After dinner, my boyfriend and I wanted to get a quick drink for our last night in SF. That quick drink happened to be a large fish bowl at Bamboo hut, and a few more drinks lol. They had a drink called Bye Felicia, which I think was named after me. Haha jk, I know... Friday. Bye Felicia. Anyways, drinks were good, and reasonably priced. 

The theme here is tiki bar themed, obviously. This bar seems to hosts a bunch of locals, where everyone seemed to know each other. The bartenders were pretty chill and cool to talk to. They also were playing a variety of cool songs... for example they were playing the Zapp and Roger album. I thought that was nice, then they played 90's gangsta rap right after, then some indie rock music.
author: Felicia L.

description: This place is in a pretty sketchy area. It was quite a walk here from where we parked. Got in and it was pretty crowded, all the seats were taken and there was only a small area open at the bar. Got a tiki bowl and shared it with 4 other friends. It was pretty good. A lot of people were dancing with the music and it's a pretty lively place. But it's not my type of crowd and the area doesn't feel too safe for me so I don't believe I will be coming back.
author: Bailey L.

description:
The Good.

-$12 bowls of pineappley drunkenness with flaming 151 in the center.
-Lighting our fingers on fire = hours of entertainment.
-Tribe. 'Pac. The Pharcyde. Dre. All sorts of 'Kast. A mix of music I haven't heard since I stopped throwing basement parties. 

The Bad. 

-"Fire is hot!" Surprise.
-The bathroom stinks, and I mean STINKS of piss. Almost as bad as the streets of San Francisco.

The Ugly.

-Me. In a kimono.
author: Peter D.

description: Decor has a few token Tiki objects, but feels more like a sports bar.  Great location though.  I noticed that every single one of their "house drink specials" Have soda in them....clear and pale in color.  Those were actually passable however moving on to the Classics....  I had the Mai Tai-every decent tiki bar should have this one mastered.  Nope not this place, it was bitter and funky tasting, I took a sip and refused to drink it..took me forever to get the taste out of my mouth.  Giving a homeless person a BJ would of tasted better.  My guy had the Navy Grog....meh. Don't think we will be coming back
author: Nippon K.

description:
The mysterious Bamboo Hut. I usually order the Dark and Stormy cause it has the least amount of ingredients and is heavy on the rum. 
I always want to hang out here, and I'm usually too drunk and leave.
Mission accomplished.
author: Ned G.

description:
Um, no. 

The volcano bowl was so watered down. But I had to drink most of it cause I didn't want to waste it. 

The fire thingy in the middle is cool and all...but no thank you. 

And the bartender was boring as fuck. No wonder this place was dead.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
'Twas at the Bamboo Hut where I became a funkle. And I set my hand on fire.

To belabor you with details as to how I deserve the familial designation with an Atomic Dog twist, or why high proof alcohol, curiosity and an open flame do not a dull moment make, would not do the night justice.

This Tiki tavern, like all Tiki taverns, are made for groups. Loners posted up at the bar better be (A) hitting on the congenial 'tenders, or (B) coating their castaway sunburns with aloe while lamenting the loss of Wilson. Wilson! WILSON!

The Volcano Bowl marries a wash of rums with two scoops of frozen sugar and a ball of fire. Drink one or sacrifice a virgin to appease its gods - either way, it'll run you $12 during happy hour.

A "ride slow" nod for thumping LL and old skool Outkast in lieu of the expected Dick Dale or Gilligan's Island theme on repeat. Just goes to show: you can't judge a juke by its cover.
author: Damien S.

description: Popped into this place while on vacation and the DJ was playing ALL the jams! Pretty chill atmosphere and cheap drinks, really enjoyed it.
author: Sharlene H.

description: Went to SF a few weeks back for a friends Birthday party. We ended up here. Such a fun night!! The "lemonade" drink was super strong at a decent price. Very good flavor. Actually spoke to the bartender who invented this masterpiece. Very friendly staff. Also split the volcano bowl with 3 other girlfriends & it was very tastey. Played good music & was very low key. Loved it. Had a blast & def will go back next time I'm back in SF.
author: Monique A.

description:
Stopped in on a Saturday Night for a drink. Bar tender was super sweet and did a solid job at making my drink when I ordered something "Strong and Sweet". 

The vibe at this place is great and the Live DJ rocks. If you get in earlier enough they have nice booths and tables. Tiny little place for dancing, but the music is just so good you can't help it. 

Bathroom is pretty clean, the velvet curtain as a door in the ladies room reminds me of a weird porn or strip club. 

I can't wait to head back here for another night out.
author: Meghan L.

description:
A tiki bar between titty bars? Why not? 

Broadway is not the street I would expect to see a tropical-themed bar. In fact we almost walked right past it. Not much to see on the outside, but a great tiki bar beach scene going on inside, complete with palm fronds, surfboards, & hanging puffer fish. 

We came specifically for the mai tais but one look at the huge ceramic bowl that holds the Volcano & we couldn't resist. Crushed pineapple & rum lit on fire? I'll take it! Plus it was $12 as opposed to the usual $20 since it was happy hour. They must have a long HH cuz we rolled in there after 8:00 & it was still going on. The Volcano Bowl is definitely enough for 3 but 2 could probably finish it off no problem. 

Before I knew it, our Volcano Bowl was empty and another one was quickly brought in as a replacement. I never did end up getting my own mai tai, but I think drinking the majority of 2 Volcano Bowls was enough for me.
author: Erin S.

description:
Volcano bowl. That's all we got. Pretty ok since it was happy hour and split between 4 people. 

Cocktail ice shake in bowl with flaming rum in the middle.

I tried to suck up the flaming rum up by a straw - don;t try it
author: Kent T.

description:
Three stars only because the bartender, Jamie, was SUPER NICE. Friendly, fast service, fun guy to have serving you drinks.

Otherwise, this place is a dive. It looks like a party store threw up discount tiki masks. Been to a few great tiki bars, this just can't compare--if you are a die hard tiki enthusiast, might wanna go here on a night you don't want to impress your friends. 

Not very clean, the bathroom was gross. 

LOTS of hipsters and groups of tourists from Europe. Funky part of town, stone's throw from a bunch of strip clubs on either side. Right next door to a porn shop and what  is now a defunct brothel. Sketchy parking lots if you want to pay to park, street parking is limited and awful on the weekends. 

Music was good on the slow night I went, but it was a weird mish-mash of 80's and early 90's music--definitely not what I expected at a tiki bar. 

Fun but tacky.
author: Bianca U.

description: Meh... but I'm a tiki freakie.  Ya see...  stood outside with my crew; shot a gaze because I saw bamboo.  There I saw sand on the floor, so I walked right through the open door.  To my surprise, I opened my eyes, the place is a dive but can I survive?  The curse of the worst Zombie drink... might I pour it down the sink?  Not for this tiki freakie... please do it right for my drinkie drinkie.  I came for the sweet tiki tiki, but over here just a weakie drinkie.  Slip sip away away away... Not goin' back here, not another day.  Away away away...
author: Joe K.

description:
We stopped in here for a drink after having dinner nearby. It was pouring outside, and this was a nice little oasis from it.

The bartender was really cool. Chatty without being overbearing, and he made awesome drinks. 
My go-to is always a dirty martini, but I figured as long as we were here, I'd go with a fun, fruity drink. 
I almost always find these kind of drinks too sweet, and too light on the alcohol, not the case here! My husband and i had different drinks, and we both loved them.

We got lucky the night we were here, and found parking right outside.Although,i think on other nights it would be a lot harder to find a spot.

If i was nearby, i would definitely stop in here again!
author: Amanda G.

description: Lucked up on this bar during my vacation. Drinks extremely good. The bartender Jamie is awesome and provided good convo and drink choices. Looking forward to returning on my next visit to San Fran.
author: Ethan P.

description:
Attended a private party here last Friday and absolutely loved it. I'm a big fan of tiki bars and Bamboo Hut is exactly the reason why! I loved the tropical themed drinks, decor and ambiance.

After two island inspired volcano bowls, I was good for the night. Loved the mermaids and monkeys that came with the bowl! Mind your manners and don't sip too fast or you might end up with a brain freeze!

The only down side is finding parking in the neighborhood. Beware of parking on Broadway and make sure you read the tow-away hours clearly or you may end up in a mess!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Bamboo Hut has two magical items which make it stand out from the majority of San Francisco bars.

1.) Pina Colada
2.) Volcano Bowl

Sip on a cold refreshing Pina Colada from a coconut bowl, while jamming to MoTown hits -  till you get brain freeze (apparently the best way to remedy said brain freeze is to jam your tongue up sharply into the roof of your mouth)

A seriously What's Up way to bring in the weekend.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
$12 volcano bowls during happy hour with sea horse and monkeys adorning the drink? Sign me up! I couldn't ask for a better way to spend an evening.

Bamboo Hut started off what ended up being a very eventful Friday night. Just a small group of us left the office with the intention of doing a low key Chinatown/North Beach Bar Crawl - and if that's what your plan is, probably shouldn't start of the night with rum drinks. Lesson learned there, folks! 

But I digress. We walked into to Bamboo Hut around 6 pm and it was relatively empty. Which I found surprising since the drinks here during happy hour are so cheap. Three of us split the giant volcano bowl and another two split the pina colada. Both were generous with the booze, yet didn't taste like rubbing alcohol. Maybe this is more of a late night spot? Regardless, we had a blast. Love a good Tiki bar and this bar is no exception. Can't wait to go back with friends and share in some more drinking delights!
author: Abby S.

description:
I always knew my first legal drink would be something fruity and on fire.

Yeah, I came here on my 21st with a couple of my friends.We shared a flaming volcano bowl, (which I know has been talked about to death on here, but how can you resist one in a place like this?) and it was fucking delicious. If you're into the whole fruity drink thing, you'll probably like it too. If not, you can just pound down some shots, or have a beer, neither of which are horribly expensive.

This place has a friendly, laid - back vibe to it. It's not intensely decorated, but you can definitely tell it's a tiki bar. The music didn't exactly match the vibe, mostly pop/hip hop stuff, because I think on slow nights, it's just the bartender fucking around with his laptop. The service is very good during slow hours and on weekdays, and although it looks like it can get crowded on the weekends, it's still worth going.
author: Angela S.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday night and it was pretty dead inside.  I personally like the divey-ness of the bar and enjoyed the music that was playing from an ipod (90's R&B, hip hop).  It totally reminded me of two hangout spots I like to kick it at back in Seattle (Ohana's and The Baltic Room).

I tried their Mimi hella lemonade, which had pineapple rum, lemonade and 151.  The drink tasted fine but it sure crept up on me later in the night.

If I did live here, I can see myself hanging out at Bamboo Hut.
author: Samantha G.

description:
I was at the Bamboo Hut in 2011 with some friends on a random Wednesday. We ordered Mai Tais that were quite good and didn't make me sick. (Tiki bar drinks have notoriously been cruel to me!) The drinks came fairly quick, so I opened a tab. 

 The music sucked and the place is stinky but I can see past that; just because I don't like the tunes they doesn't mean the place sucks. What they lost me with was the drunk bartender, not tipsy, obnoxiously DRUNK! this wouldn't be such a bad thing if they hadn't charged my credit card *twice* after I had paid my tab in cash. I have no way of knowing if they were just drunk and stupid, or were actually trying to pull something. I got the money back from the bank but still, what a pain in the ass. 

In short, I will not be back.
author: Toni A.

description:
I'm writing this in response to Cristofer P's review below...

Dating Tip No. 524, if you're so diluted in your attempts to impress the girl who agreed to go out with you (I'm guessing out of pity or some bet gone awry) that you would even consider dragging her to a bar on Broadway laced with casual drinkers, social party goers and those who generally want to have a good time then I feel for whatever poor soul you one day bed down. "Yes, let's go to a bar with loud music, flaming volcano bowls, and rowdy folks to have an intimate, starry eyed romance..." Are you dense? Go to the hut with your lady to have fun and interact, not to sit like a bump on the wall across from each other and talk art. I digress...

As to the comments about the bar...

*"Somehow filling the great chasm between dive bar and tiki lounge is the Bamboo Hut. It doesn't manage to quite achieve either of those things..." IT IS A TIKI DIVE BAR and achieves exactly that. If you're expecting some bar you saw in the movie Swingers so you can act out what you thought your life should have been then go to LA. 

*The drink menu is such that everyone from new bar attendees to legitimate Tikiphiles have something available...if you don't like tiki drinks then get whatever the f*ck you want...how can you b*tch about that?

*Okay yes, the music is all over the place however, it's completely different from the rest of Broadway! That's why people go there! That's why I go there! My girls and I dance here pretty much every time we come...hey, sometimes it's fun to dance to Billy Idol. Also at least half the time I'm there I see girls climb up on the bar and dance...no comment...ha.

*So you don't like cheezy comedies on display in the background for your amusement? Maybe you' d prefer Glen Beck?

Okay I don't mean to be terrible but I'm tired of seeing crappy reviews on Yelp for awesome places because people have no clue what they're getting into or their carnal advances didn't go as planned. Expect the world from a bar where the bartenders wear ties...expect a good time from a place where the bartenders where t-shirts of obscure rock bands...maybe next time you should stay home.
author: Katherine F.

description: Great bar. Great music. Bartenders are funny and nice. $5 cover for men . Ladies are free. LOts of drink specials. DONT LET THE FIRE FOOL YOU. The bowl volcano drinks are terrible.
author: Lynne Marie Raguindin B.

description: Pretty cool place on North Beach located around the bar/strip club scene in The city. Went in for a few drinks with my friends from Uni because it had a cool theme and we had a pretty good time. The bar is a super Dive bar, pretty small & covered in tiki decorations. They serve signature fruity island theme drinks such as daiquiris, piña coladas, and mai tais. I decided to get the drink they are famous for, their Volcano Bowl a fantastic mix of liquors with cherries, plastic monkeys & seahorses in a huge bowl with a tiny bowl in the middle filled with alcohol that's on FIRE! Yes, literally ON FIRE! As a pyro I get so much with this drink for only $12 (you can share this or be a greedy boozer and have it by yourself!) cool place for pre drinks or on a pub crawl, but not somewhere you'd stay at all night.
author: Layla M.

description:
LOL this place is good digs. Interesting crowd, amazing dj, strong drinks, and tispy bartenders. What can go wrong? I dont like sweet drinks at all, but the bartender recommened the pineapple volcano bowl and it was tasty! 
Definetly not a place for everyone, but I'm quite alright with that!
author: Kristina B.

description: This place is pretty lively on a week night. Now having said that, they had plenty of awesome decor. Wifey and I ordered the pina colada and the volcano drink. Pretty cool how they can make something like a margarita come to life. Wasn't too impressed with the wait time but the music was cool. Wifey will probably force me to come back next time. -_-
author: William S.

description: It may not be the most authentic of Tiki bars, but it's a nice place to hang out at on a weekday. Cheap drinks and cool neighborhood bartenders.
author: Jon T.

description:
A tropical-themed dive bar with sugary drinks that go straight to your brain! It has its purposes. I can still feel that lemony drink that tasted a bit like lysol, probably could have done without that one. The volcano bowl was visually impressive and was a fun drink to share, but if you're expecting any other taste beyond starburst soaked in vodka then look elsewhere. I did enjoy my mai tai, and the bartenders were friendly. I also appreciate the DJ situation. 

All in all, a decent place for the right night. Proceed with caution and hydrate.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Reggie is the best bartender! He's attentive, gracious and makes the best mai tais. I will definitely  be back!
author: Lee D.

description: Great for hanging out with friends having some drinks and getting crazy!!! Mario the bartender/ manager is great really makes it a great vibe... Whether you're just ready to Enjoy drinks with friends or meet up new people... It's a great centrally located place...
author: Mayra S.

description:
If you're looking for a tiki bar or a place that will serve all the fruity tropical drinks you desire, look no further.  

In my experience, it seems that the options in the city for the tiki bar atmosphere fall to Bamboo Hut, the Tonga Room, and Smuggler's Cove.  The Tonga Room is definitely suffering from price inflation, so reserve this place for rare occasions when you want the full experience of this slice of SF history.  I also struggle with categorizing Smuggler's Cove as a tiki bar, because I think of it more as a bar that specializes in rum-based cocktails (my favorites) and happens to have some decor resembling the tropics.  So in my mind, Bamboo Hut is the best bona fide tiki bar in the city.  But just because it won the title by process of elimination doesn't mean you're settling.  

There are a few booths, a semi-private room with bench seats and a long table (think coffee table rather than dining table), then of course the bar and standing room.  Apparently you can/should reserve the "private" area if you plan on bringing a large group during peak hours.  (I say "private" because there is no door closing it off from the rest of the bar, but you do have walls on 3 or the 4 sides so it is a little more isolated).

While they can make you whatever tropical drink (blended or not) that your heart desires, you obviously cannot come here without opting for the volcano bowl.  Blended deliciousness (think daquiri meets pina colada) in a large specifically crafted ceramic bowl with room for lighter fluid (aka a very flammable liquor?) in the center to complete the full volcanic experience comes with many a long straw because you're going to want to share this bad boy.  

There's a "Jukebox" you can pay to play the song of your choice which works much better on a afternoon before the bar-hopping crowds arrive.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: One of my favorite bars in sf! I seriously want to try all their drinks! Each drink has its own unique name and flavor. I've only been here twice and the first time I got a volcano bowl that me and a couple of my friends shared and the second time I went I got the Bye Felicia. I loved both drinks and they were really cheap too! Can't wait to go back!
author: Rohana L.

description: Why not 5 stars? Great vibes. Excellent, friendly, competent service. Great tunes. An extra friendly bartender on this visit. Thank you!!
author: LeVanna V.

description: Stop by for st patty weekends had rounds w/ the best bartender ever!
author: Linda B.

description:
I came here with a group of 8 people on a random Sunday night. It wasn't too packed; we were able to get seating without a problem. We ordered two flaming volcanoes between our group, and it was definitely enough. However, there was some inconsistency between the two volcanoes; one was much stronger than the other. The drink did taste good though, and I thought it was strong enough, even though it's kind of a fruity drink. It is pretty much a dish with a margarita style drink and in the middle compartment is a shot of 151, which they light on fire, hence the "flaming" aspect. 

I would bring my friends here again, especially because it's such a unique thing. The bar environment is very chill, more like a dive bar experience. It's not the cleanest place, but it's good if you're bar hopping.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Come to have a good time with a group friends

Volcano Bowl:
- yummy and strong, and yes, it does have a flame in the middle
- would highly recommend

Entertainment:
- live music that night [cover is $5 for guys] - get up and dance!
- nights without live music charge no cover

Atmosphere:
- decor was like a legit tiki house
- dirty videos playing on the screen (uh oh! but hey, this is the red light district)  
- tables are always slightly sticky, sometimes the seats are too...

Bathroom:
- large and sometimes not stocked with toilet seat covers

Service:
- friendly and fast

Overall: 4.5 stars for a good time with good service and drinks, minus 0.5 stars for cleanliness
author: Tina A.

description:
Not sure if the bartender was new or was just really bad at opening and man-ing the fort at an early hour, but service was pretty bad.

On a brighter note, this place is ideal if you want to get smashed. 151 in fruity blended concoctions? Only $20 for a flaming bowl of drunk? SIGN ME UP.
author: Maggie L.

description:
I invited a grip of friends to the Bamboo Hut on a Saturday night to take advantage of their yelp drink specials.

I mean, how could I say no to a $10 Volcano Bowl??

Tiki bars are my favorite, but they do tend to burn through your wallet rather quickly.

So my friends and I stayed for an hour or so enjoying volcano bowls. They offer pineapple and strawberry, with the latter being my preference.

All was going well initially. We got there at 7 (even though their door says 8?), and there was seating everywhere. There was about 10 of us, so we grabbed the bench seating in the back.

Loved the bowls, but I did not love the Bamboo Breeze cocktail. It was not at all what I expected. I'm not even sure if I got what was intended. I thought it would be blended, but it was essentially tequila on the rocks. No bueno. 

What would have been a 4 star experience became a 2 star experience when the bartender (who we had been generously tipping since the bowls were so cheap) came over after only a little over an hour to tell us a group called in and reserved the table we were sitting at, and that we had to move when they got there.

WTF? The whole reason I had my group of friends get there at 7 was to guarantee we'd have a great spot for an evening of Tiki drinks. Why didn't he at least give us a heads when we sat down? Seems completely bogus to me.

I have never heard of a bar doing this before, and I was and still am very skeptical. Maybe if their website had a speck of information on it, I could find out if he wasn't full of it. 

So 9:40 hit, and some random dude came over cleaning up all of our glasses making it very obvious we couldn't sit there anymore. Rude.

The crowd also became very thuggish and douchey after 9:00 (yes, even for North Beach). Every one of my friends (and myself included) who used the restroom at one point were hassled in some way, either face-to-face or by people randomly banging on the bathroom door. Perhaps they needed to lay off the booger sugar. One-toilet bathrooms weren't designed for group activities!

Due to this, I will not be returning to Bamboo Hut. It was all fine and dandy with the yelp prices and the early crowd, but after 9pm it was witching hour and the bar had completely changed its tune. No thanks.

Should I even mention how juvenile the music was? I'm talking middle school dance.  Terrible.

I'll be sticking to Smuggler's Cove, Tonga Room, and Trader Sam's. Some common respect is worth the extra cash.
author: Katie S.

description: Cool place with tropical drinks. The bartender was really friendly. Real chill vibe.
author: Marc E.

description: This place is great for their happy hour. It lasts from opening till 9 and they have great deals, including $12 volcano bowls (normally $20, which is still cheap)! Go here for great deals on good drinks!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Not the cleanest place in the neighborhood I must admit, but...

Wowza. 

Where in the world can u get 5 shots of vodka for $18? Dare I say impressive...or is that just something dangerous waiting to happen? 

$3 shots perplex me. 

The mixed drink specials are a pretty sweet deal, too, and I mean that literally. With names such as Mimi's Lemonade ($8) and Mango Madness ($8) you can only expect a different mix of sugary delights. Both cocktails were delicious, but were creepers waiting to hit.

Not as impressive, however, was their cleanliness. Although there was ample table space to choose from, and even an open private area in the back that could easily fit 10 people, the moment I sat I felt something sticky on my derriere. Apparently their bench wasn't clean. It left a slimy, sticky film on my jeans. I walked into the bathroom to clean myself off a bit, only to find the sink falling apart.

Cleanliness aside, the bartender was very friendly. Drinks were served pretty fast and kind words and jokes were shared.

Bottom Line:
Would I come back? Sure. For a quick $3 shot, no problem. I'll be sure to check my surroundings before I sit down though.
author: Joy A.

description: This place was PACKED. I would have liked to try their Volcano Bowl, or whatever the hell they call it, but just getting to the bar for a beer was a chore. Not sure if it's always this packed, but if it is I'm avoiding it. Oh, AND I had to pay a cover charge. LAME.
author: John H.

description:
Bamboo Hut, now THAT'S the liveliness I'm lookin' for on a Saturday night. Too bad you are such a small place. It was definitely the feeling of "sardines stacked in a tin can". It was hard to move around if you could at all and bumping into someone was the requirement of the night if you wanted to go from the front of the place to the back and so forth. And at the midnight hour expect it to be standing room only.

Drinks were great and my shot of Grey Goose at $9 wasn't that hefty of a price. Once in a while you can get some bumpin' jams on the stereo and if you clear out a square foot of space to yourself manage to get groovin'. Not a bad place to meet people as well as long as you can wiggle and negotiate your way through the masses.
author: Randy T.

description:
OMG....VOlcano bowl..can we say hangover? I think I drank about a quarter of it... Let's just say that I had a headache all night and slept horribly because of it. But it is super yummy! The 151 is definitely masked  by the ultra sweetness! 

The bartender was awesome! Will be back again!
author: Helen V.

description:
Ummm... consider this a very biased review... But then, I wouldn't be a very good Yelper if I weren't judgmental, now would I?

So this is where all the trash in SF hangs out?

Got charged $22 for two shots (valued at $7 a piece) and the bartender was so stupid he didn't know how to refund the difference, so he offered free drinks (which I wasn't feeling at the time) instead. Then he takes off with said shots (still full, by the way) thinking we were done. Another five minutes go by before the shots are returned and we finally get our "free" drinks.

Awful experience, awful service. We will not be returning...
author: Matthew B.

description: A volcano bowl was awesome and free pizza slices for hungry people were a great idea BUT bartenders were so drunk that they lost our credit card.. I can't believe! I would like to go again because of cocktails but let's see.. Maybe only with cash.
author: Milla E.

description: Mimi was awesome!!!  Great drinks.  Fast service.  They were awesome!!!
author: Evan B.

description: I was in the city for a work conference and brought a group of co workers in. Had a great time. The bartender was sweet. When I realized I needed to start drinking some water he put it in a coconut cup with an umbrella and lime. Thank you Mr bartender on 5/10/13. This place was a hit with the group. Sorry if we got rowdy.
author: Tanya B.

description: $2 pbr! That goes a long way. Otherwise, the usual overpriced fiery tiki cocktails.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Douche-y-est crowd I've ever seen in a SF bar. 

I ended up here Saturday around midnight and it truly reminded me why I never go out on amateur night.

But maybe it's just me...as I was about to leave a group of three guys were like "hey...where are you going? you look really out of place...in a GOOD way." lol
author: Rachel M.

description:
This place has some great elements - group seatings, secluded lounge area, decent music, fun volcano bowl. 

Add it up and you have a pit stop for otherwise mundane bar hopping in lower North Beach area.
author: Kali F.

description: This is not an everyday type of bar, but if you're in the mood to rage a bit and are north of Market it's not a bad place to end up. The bartenders here are super friendly and there's usually a DJ or band keeping things lively. Skip the beers and cocktails and dive straight into a Scorpion Bowl for $20 to share with three of your best friends. Tonga Room seems to be getting all the love these days, but this is the real deal Tiki Bar in SF.
author: Madhu P.

description:
My drink of choice...a dirty martini. But this doesn't mean I'm one to pass up a good "girly" drink. When in a tiki bar do as the natives do and go with fruity. 

I have not tried a bowl here. But I have had the Lava Flow consisting of light rum, strawberry puree, pineapple, and coconut mix. So delicious and fruity.

The service here was friendly and while sitting at the bar I saw that they have a number of regulars they know by first name. While that may never be me...I live on the other side of town, I will definitely stop in here again with more people and try one of those magical bowls.
author: Maria M.

description:
It was awesome!! Mario was great and his spirit and vigor made me want to come back every day!
The huge drink that they lit on fire was the most delicious and fun thing that I have ever had!
author: Maggie S.

description:
This place is so cool, why so little stars!?

Its not perfect, but I feel like that miiiiight be location based.

I came in with a group of 4 on a saturday night around 8pm. Snagged a booth and a volcano bowl and thoroughlly enjoyed ourselves until about 11pm when party buses started showing up (laaame).

The bartender was awesome, made us 2 delicious volcano bowls (with a ton of little plastic mermaids. thanks!!!) annnnd put on Jackass 2 for the bars viewing pleasure. 

I cant wait to go back!
author: Britney K.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night.  It transformed from dead to packed in about 15 minutes.  Great DJ with lots of fun dance music although there wasn't really anywhere to dance since it was so small and crowded.

Had to try the Volcano since it's what they're known for.  The flaming 151 was a nice touch.  However, once you take a sip everything seems a little less appealing.  the drink is very sweet, and you can barely taste any alcohol.  And once the ice melts it tastes like cough syrup.  Maybe it's because we tried the Strawberry Volcano, but it's way too sweet for my taste.

Also, one of the bathrooms was out of order which only left one for both men and women.  Long lines for a bathroom are a big no no for me.  Not cool when you need to tinkle.
author: Alex R.

description:
My friends and I decided to overlook the bad reviews of this bar in favor for their Volcano Bowl during Yelp Drinks Week 2012. It was kinda dead when we walked in but every table and bar space was still taken up. The bartenders were really cool and laid-back. 

The volcano bowl was just one big slushy with a hint of rum and 151. Interesting to look at, and not bad for $10 (normally $20) to share between 4 people but too weak of a drink to get my Friday night started off. Be careful of brain freeze!

I preferred their Bamboo Breeze more for the minty, mojito taste. The alcohol was stronger in this one.

Someone was setting up some band equipment... perhaps for a live performance later on? But we up and left after we finished our drinks, and just in time too as a group of already-drunk and annoying Asian girls walked through the door screeching, "OMG, look at this place!" What was there to look at? Dark, dingy Tiki wanna-be on Broadway. Good for a stop on your bar crawl, but not the way to end your night with!
author: Liana L.

description:
Oh Bamboo Hut, how I love you!  You look so sketchy on the outside but are so tiki-licious and inviting on the inside!

If you come here, you MUST have a volcano bowl.  Fire + liquor smoothie + sharing with friends = good times!  Plus, if you are lucky, you might run into MCLOVIN! (Yes, this happened. Yes, he was mackin' on a girl WAY to hot for him :P)
author: Liz H.

description:
Pretty chill pad daddy-o. Stopped in here on my way to the opening of Monroe's and have to say I was pretty impressed with my Tiki themed cocktail the Zombie.

The staff is super chill and together we fight crime. And by fight crime I mean we where looking at some a-holes trying to break into cars and when I saw a cop driving up I pointed in their general direction to which the cops busted their punk asses! The one dude tried to run after they had the cuffs on and fell right on his face. We all laughed good that day.

I'm taking one star off though because the Giants lost the first game while I was there.  So maybe don't go during Giants games.
author: Jason S.

description: Best punch bowl drink on broadway. Pineapple strawberry mix is great, I would suggest that if you have 2 or 3 people. Full size bar, which fits 15 people add several booths and a ton of tiki stuff and you have a sweet bar. The bartenders favor girls (what tender doesn't). Prices aren't bad either.
author: Steve L.

description: Really tasty drinks. Volcano Bowl comes in Banana, Strawberry, Coconut, or some mixture of those three. $20 and VERY boozy. Decorations were kitschy, super nice bartender. Clientele was... interesting...
author: Kajal G.

description:
Best happy hour in the city, as long as you don't mind girly drinks. 

Between the Pina Coladas (served in plastic coconuts of course) and the $12 Volcano Bowls (served flaming) you might not make it out of here alive. One of the best tiki themed dive bars around.
author: Jeska D.

description:
I'm embarrassed to even admit that i've been here. It was only for 5 minutes I swear! But ya know... it fits right in with the rest of those clubs on the same block...

In one word: disgusting.

ok, i have a few more words..: smelly, small, dirty and filled with a buncha drunk people because the only way you could tolerate this place is if you were completely plastered
author: Layla L.

description:
Tiki bar ooh tiki bar, how I love thee. I am a total slut for divey, kitschy tiki bars and Bamboo Hut gives me a major woody every single time. They used to have a board of specialty shots for $5 (which I haven't seen in a while) but my personal favorite was the Pearl Necklace ;-).

Come during happy hour, their already reasonable prices get quite reasonable! $12 for that massive volanco bowl? Hells yes!

They do get incredibly packed on weekends, and whenever they have a live band there is a cover charge, $10 I believe.
author: Daneca V.

description: The Volcano Bowl lacked the explosion of 151 that I was expecting, but for $10 (half off Yelp Drinks!), it'll have to do for a very light buzz.  Too bad the only thing explosive was the drunk girl's boobs popping out of her top at this dive bar.  No wait, is that really a good or bad thing?
author: Kevin W.

description:
fun vibe, casual, cheap, people are nice. great for HH. 
volcano slush drinks are pretty (dangerously) tasty.
author: Victoria K.

description: This place is AWESOME!  For what it is, I think it's doing it right.  Came here on a Friday night for the first stop on our holiday pub crawl.  We were able to get a good spot for our group of 12, which was nice and happy hour was going until 9!  The Volcano drinks are tasty and reasonably priced!  And, of course, they are super fun!  The decor is fitting and they have some fun signs.  The DJs were AWESOME!! We went to a few other places looking for a fun dance party and ended up coming back here for the great jams.  It's a small place but it wasn't crazy crowded and everyone was great.  I will definitely be back!!  Also, NO COVER!
author: Genevieve S.

description:
I freakin' love this place! I can't believe I've only been here once...!

I planned my bfffffff's 21st bday here and it was successful and spectacular! She was pleasantly surprised + happy about the place. I must mention that the outside of the place doesn't quite do the inside justice. From the outside, it can be easily missed, and it doesn't look quite attractive. Inside, it's very well illuminated with miscellaneous island-themed decorations. I likey.

We ordered so many drinks that it's pretty hard to review them. I'd stick with the volcano bowls because the regular drinks didn't seem very strong. The volcano bowls will fuck you up ;)
author: Bonita C.

description:
Tiki lounges generally have pretty easy going staff but this one tops my list as the friendliest establishment (in any category) in my entire drinking adulthood. Albeit my drinking adulthood has been short, because just like any good kid I waited until I was 21, I did go to college in a college town - that should count for something right?

Good people, good times  :)
author: Candy C.

description:
Basically, we almost set the bar on fire (doing Statue of Liberty shots), and the bartender exclaimed, "You weren't the first, you probably won't be the last!"

I'd give them a -1 for a dirty bathroom, but I've seen worse. At least the men's room has a working door lock.
author: Harold C.

description:
Dear Bamboo Hut,

OH how I adore thee simple wonderful-ness that is you. You are a safe haven of Tiki proportions. You made me feel like a Hula Gurl on my birthday, and for that I will be eternally thankful.  

You presented, as a birthday token, Ariel the DJ, who by all accounts and means wasn't even an embryo when she busted out with the BEST set that ONLY a true Soul Sister would understand. The party didn't stop there, we did the Limbo and practiced the Mashed Potato...we also 'dropped it like it was hot' even though some of us couldn't get back up again.

Mixologist Mustachio was like the cool parent. Keeping us respectfully imbibed with refreshing island beverages that almost made me forget I was still in my Hood and not in Maui. 

All in all this is a fantastic spot, that puts out. I TOTALLY got lei'd, and what more could a Hula Gurl want on her birthday.?!
author: emma g.

description:
Volcano bowl(s) = giant bowl filled with fruity drink plus FIRE
+
little plastic mermaids in the drinks (and somehow in my purse the next morning whaat?)
+ 
8 friends cramming into a little booth
+
musical favorites including the Footloose song
+
sighting of MCLOVIN aka christopher mintz plasse
-
sighting of MCLOVIN because he was too busy mackin' on some girl to turn around when I tapped him on the shoulder to say hi.
-----------------------------------------------------
= a great night
author: Cathy Y.

description:
There are some tiki bars you go for the ambiance such as the Tonga Room.  Some you go to for the sheer perfection of their cocktail making like Smuggler's Cove ( I know it's more pirate ship but tiki bar but the drinks are the key ) Some however fall in a whole other category I'd like to call people watching.  At no other tiki bar in the bay area this is king more than at the Bamboo Hut.  First off the place doesn't have much to the design.  There's some of the typical kitschy tiki bar stuff but nothing to write home about.  The drinks are tasty and strong and probably the best value of the ones I've been to. The staff is friendly and quick. The patrons however...

It's a crap shoot every night.  It's that people watching game of craps that keeps me coming back for more.  I love the location in the heart of Broadway in North Beach.  It's always been a sanctuary for me when I duck and dodge all the people attempting to lure me into their strip joints as I walk down the main drag.  This sanctuary has always been the best value entertainment on Broadway as it is get this.... free entrance.  The bevy of personalities that have the potential of walking in is astounding. From short people with canes dressed in Smooth Criminal outfits to Russian Gangsters chatting with Peruvian surfers is just the tip of the iceberg when trying to describe who you might end up chatting with.  In many cases if you were to run into any of these people in the street you might find yourself trying to avoid them but at Bamboo Hut you are forced through the powers of alcohol and close proximation to each other to commiserate.  For some magical reason all the fears people have of stereotypes disappear when walking through the doors of the Bamboo Hut.

So my personal review is I love Bamboo Hut but it certainly isn't for everyone because it has such a unique feel to most other tiki bars.  Imagine if Mr. Bings and Kona Club had a baby the Bamboo hut would be it's love child.
author: Joco F.

description: My friend and I went here on 5-31-14 8:00pm'sh for a birthday party.  I ordered two hara cane $8, this was surprisingly good and bartender is cool, also had the langunitas and anchor $5 (the beer could be slightly cooler).  The dj was playing both old and new school music. I recognized a few individuals who attended this bar.
author: Jer W.

description:
I really really really like the Bamboo Hut and it is one of my favorite places in the city. I always have a really great time, sometimes weird, but always fun.

Every time I'm in North Beach I somehow convince the people I'm with to grab some drinks here. I mean, you can't go wrong with sweet, juicy, tropical drinks in a bar decked out in tiki decor. It is very small but I've never had issues with that or with it being crowded. Oh, and the bartenders are cute, nice and quick! 

The Bamboo Hut also has great drink specials for cocktails and beer. If you are looking for a great deal and a great drink go for the VOLCANO BOWL. Oh my goodness, for twelve dollars you get a volcano bowl filled with  booze and topped off with fire, plastic monkeys, seahorses and cherries. So much fun, especially for a group (or just two!).
author: Denise S.

description:
really gross
like bacardi, pineapple juice, grenadine, & a cherry & theres your "tiki drink"
the jukebox was the most tolerable part (punk rock)
we took  a 4  min bus ride from chinatown (some of the streets are a little steep going northbound)
the menu boasts of "tiki drinks" but like i already mentioned, they all either have bacardi, 151 or some other soul-less un-inspiring rum.
yeah, the decor's tiki related & not bad , city lights bookstore is around the corner, but skip this :(
author: belinda n.

description:
Fun place to hang out with a group of rowdy friends and to catch up on loud idle chatter while wiping pieces of palm fronds off your black attire.

Reminds me of the other joint on Geary, Trader Sam's, whose clientele was a bit questionable, but I love the ease and anonymity of hiding behind students and biker people.......

Large drinks, good for females to get tipsy on, since I consumed a vat of strange pinkish concoction, then promptly got sick on the ride back to the Red Room.  

Great bartenders though, they remembered my friend's order and gave me free ginger ale to lighten up the evening.
author: Miika M.

description:
Cool place to hang out. Bar tenders are friendly and has a fun atmosphere. Drink prices are a little high though and the bathrooms smell incredibly bad.

But when we have a night out in SF we'll drop by again.
author: Betty N.

description: Hoppin spot on Broadway!! Happy hour offers great deals! Will be back! Professional staff and polite. Dj got it rockin!
author: Bill D.

description: I have to say, for a small dive bar, this place is full of surprises.  Can you imagine a Hawaiian themed bar blasting Eminem music. It was quite funny and amusing to me.  They have some pretty cool island themed drinks and the bartender there seemed quite accomodating as I have witnessed some folks bringing in their own alcohol and requesting the bartender making drinks with that.  Pretty awesome.  We tried the "tipsy turtle", which to me felt like a more lethal version of long Island.  Honestly thought it  tasted like crap to me, but dont worry, I was sober, so to "normal party folks" this should be just right.  The drink was definitely given a generous amount of alcohol and you get to take home a plastic monkey as a souvenior.
author: Young N.

description: Was out for a girls night and was bar hopping in north beach. Granted this was our fifth bar of the night, but it was a great one to end with. We went during the niners playoff game so every bar was packed with niners fan cheering on kapernick, while the three of us were drinking till no tomorrow (unfortunately tomorrow came and it wasn't so pretty) but we had a blast regardless. :) Has an awesome mai-tai like drink with barcadi 151 flamining in the middle. We shared that and well, the rest of the night was just ridiculousness. Thanks to the staff for putting up with our craziness and insanity. I know drunk people can be a handful and too much sometimes. x)
author: linda p.

description: I do applaud the Bamboo Hut's $3 Pabst -- which for being in the middle of North Beach, I was overall pretty happy with.  Maybe during the week this could be a chill spot but during the weekends, could take it or leave it.
author: Mel G.

description: WORST SERVICE EVER!!! One bartender decided to go smoke a cigarette leaving this tattooed idiot in charge. Brilliant idea! He spent more time dancing and pouring shots for himself than making drinks for patrons. Finally gave up and went to other guy when he got back. $30 and 20 minutes later I finally got a drink... Too bad it was terrible. The only thing this place has going for it is good music. Save your money and go elsewhere!
author: Jo W.

description:
A random ass Tiki dive bar in the midst of a strip of Broadway clubs and strip clubs.  We wandered in here to get some cheap fuel and get hammered quick before we hit the clubs on Broadway.  The bartenders are really fun and kickback....same with the drinks.  You know those themed parties you go to, and it really feels like you're in a different city/country/era?  Nahhh, this is nothing like that.  The atmosphere of the bar has a cheeesy feel to it, and it definitely does not feel like you're on some tropical island.

....But considering we go there to get hammered quick off of girly drinks on a Saturday night in the midst of titty bars.........whaddaya expect?  I like.
author: Betty W.

description:
This place is like the "Cheers" of North Beach. It's hardly ever so loud that you can't strike up conversations with the regulars, and it's easy to become one of those regulars yourself. Being a fancy beer gal, I never thought I'd have so many Pina Coladas in my life, but Mimi knows how to make them right, and I apparently know how to drink them. It's the kind of place that feels like a good secret, being tucked away in the midst of a thousand strip clubs, I never would have gone in if I weren't invited. Now I find myself there at least once a week, and if I didn't live so far, I'm sure it would be far more  than that.

It's a four star dive bar, but the atmosphere and the bartenders make it a solid five!!!
author: Mez L.

description:
My friends and I randomly wandered into Bamboo Hut, and it was one of the best unplanned nights ever. There were $4 tropical cocktails, two tons of sand on the floor (!!!), and guys buying us drinks without expecting us to talk to them whatsoever. (I officially dig native San Franciscans and Texans). Can a girl ask for more? 

Of course! We got lei'd multiple times and free flip-flops, a tank top, and a glow stick. I felt like I was back in Hawaii with the tiki atmosphere and sand between my toes. Man, I really miss home now. Looks like it may be time for another trip to Bamboo Hut!
author: Liz T.

description: It's definitely a little taste of island-y-ness in the city. I stopped in and grabbed some drinks and enjoyed the low-key atmosphere in a booth. Good place to meet up and enjoy the music and drink some brews.
author: Mandy B.

description:
Lovin this bar!

If your confused or scared of the entrance don't be shy.  Its really happy inside.

NO COVER!!!!!!!!!!!!! :) ((i always buy hella drinks no need to cover charge me!))

The bars tacky tiki decor is awesome

The strong drinks on the menu are strong and sooo tasty so if your in the mood....

Pretty nice looking bartenders.  Its busy but they will chat it up with you.

There was some dooshy people in the bar, but thats not the bars fault.  Its loud enough in there to tone them out and focus on you and your friends.

Thinking of having my party here.
author: Jacelyn M.

description:
I consider this a SF secret because it took me so long to discover.  Since learning of this joint, I bring all my European guests to Bamboo Hut to give them a taste of what they thought California would be like ("W-w-why-y-yyyy is it so c-c-c-c-olllllld in SF? W-w-wherrrre is the s-s-s-sssun?!")

Best Parts:

+  Volcano Bowl.  Always a crowd pleaser.  Share up to 5, or limit to three to get a buzz.

+  Guy serving the drinks.  He's funny, has great taste in music (all the music you hear comes from his iPod), and goes out of his way to make out-of-towners fall in love with San Francisco, starting with his bar.  Make friends with him and maybe you'll even get to close the place down.

+  Gettin' lei'd.  That's right, the super friendly barman will lei you if you're fun enough or ask nicely.

+  Girls who drink something with an umbrella in it are looking for something.  Gentlemen, this is a great place to meet such girls so that you can give it to them.


Drawback:

+ I don't understand why they keep the door to this place WIDE open.  It's chilly at night, man!  At least put some beads or a grass skirt over the door, or something!
author: Dmytro A.

description: Fun spot with a cool theme. Bartender was really nice and drink prices were very reasonable. I will defiantly come back
author: Cody M.

description:
The Bamboo Hut has a fantastic and cheap Happy Hour! The drinks have plenty of alcohol, but the way they mix them, they still taste great! Additionally, you can order gigantic mixed drinks like at the Tonga Room.... only at dive bar prices minus the cheesy band and minus geriatric dancers taking up the dance floor.  

There's nothing more awesome than getting drunk in a bar with a tiki theme. It only gets better when you leave the tiki bar behind to stumble out onto the street and find you are in the middle of more strip clubs than you know what to do with. In short, the bamboo hut is an oasis in which the bartenders are friendly and do a good job of making sure everyone gets a drink.
author: Cynthia M.

description: I came here on a Tuesday night  at the recommendation of a friend I was meeting. I have to say when I heard it was on Broadway I was thinking great hooker town but this place oddly ,makes you forget about the girls without souls dancing naked 100 yards away. The bartender who is Not Asian, defiantly don't call him Chinese was freakin hysterical. He was like a improv performer, I'd go back again just to talk about inappropriate things with him again. Didn't try any of the tiki drinks but will have one of those volcano bowls to myself next time. Also the music I went was like the 2001/2002 soundtrack to my life, brought back fond memories. So pretty much this is not a upscale lounge but a pretty chill fun bar to have a good laugh.
author: Crystal V.

description:
Dating Tip No. 523. A booth in a busy bar should either be for entourages, or if it's just a guy and a girl, for making out. There's nothing that screams awkward more loudly than two people trying to hold a conversation in a loud crowded bar by taking up an entire booth to themselves.

Somehow filling the great chasm between dive bar and tiki lounge is the Bamboo Hut. It doesn't manage to quite achieve either of those things, but finds some redemption in its creative drinks (some were a bit too creative). The eclectic selection of music played way too loudly makes conversation here impossible, and the random oldies ballads inserted at inopportune intervals discourage any dancing from taking place. Combined with tv screens playing Dumb & Dumber and you've got a bar full of people staring off into space, focused on anything but each other. If this is being social, next time I'll stay home.
author: Cristofer P.

description: Pretty raucous crowd having a good time. But was rather small with ok service. You definitely want to go with friends that are loud and want to get drunk.
author: Victor C.

description:
I love this place.  
Well mostly.
I like the decorations, the bartenders, the music, the drinks, but however they sadly seem to get a large number of douche bags.
Honestly though, the main reason I come here at all is for a drink called the CHI-CHI.  It is served in a glass coconut and has a sprinkle of heaven in it. Other then that I have no idea what it is and I look gay drinking it but the taste is worth it.  Try it is up there with the best drinks ever.
author: Eli B.

description: Definitely got the Volcano Bowl with a few others and also took advantage of the PBR and fernet deal [like $7 for a can and a shot].  The bartender was sooo nice and I just love the feel of the place.  We definitely left inhebriated   lol.  I want to go back and try the Zombie!
author: Paige W.

description:
we aren't from the SF area and having just arrived the day before, we stopped in on a recent monday night at about 10pm on the recommendation of our hotel concierge.  first thing i noticed?  pretty crowded for a monday, especially compared to other bars.  second thing i noticed?  about 5-6 skateboards stacked by the door.  apparently this is a preferred mode of transport in this city.  the crowd seemed quite mixed; there were people who looked like they were there after work while others looked a lot less casual.  however, since i'm not from SF, maybe the work dress code is more lax than NYC's!

we grabbed two of the few empty seats at the bar and jamie the bartender was awesome - very friendly and fun to talk to.  he also made a great drink recommendation, although i was pretty buzzed by that point and don't remember the name - sorry!  i had 2 or 3 of them, and they were quite labor intensive!  

i wondered how the 2 restrooms met the building code requirement if that place was filled to capacity!  but on this night, there were no lines and the ladies' room was pretty clean.

the highlight of the night?  being the only met fan in the bar watching them beat the giants at home in extra innings!  

if i head back to SF, i'd make it a point to stop in here again.
author: Tricia R.

description: i was too chicken to try the volcano bowl (it's ginormous!)  but i tried the lava flow, which is also a drink special. The lava flow wasn't bad...very pineappley, not very boozey though.  the bartenders are friendly and very tolerant of drunk, crazy, dancing weirdos like the group I came with.  I have been here before and i had a good time then, too.  The place is pretty small, but the drinks have decent prices so it's a good little stop during a night out.  Also, I apologize to the girl whose sunglasses I pocketed.  I was sloshed.
author: Joy K.

description: Strange bar that makes little effort to differentiate itself from its neighbors on Broadway. The drinks were watered down, the lights were turned up bright, and the floor was a sticky mess. All this quite early in the night. Not recommended!
author: Nikhil V.

description:
As of today, Bamboo Hut has installed facial-recognition cameras from an app developer called Scenetap.  The cameras scan and determine the gender of people in the bar, then report the statistics online: http://scenetap.com/san-francisco/venues  Unless Bamboo Hut has started handing out release forms at the door, I don't think I'll be going back.

EDIT: See comment below from Bamboo Hut.  They have decided to cancel the Scenetap system.  Thanks, Bamboo Hut!
author: E. G.

description:
The Bamboo Hut is as good as it gets for little hole in the wall bars. The bartenders were awesome and fast. The DJ was good and was willing to play requests and they have these to die for drinks called Volcanos that come in huge bowls that they light on fire. Best night I have had in the city in a while!

Def go to place if you are on Broadway!
author: Lacey C.

description:
Stopped by here for a drink since the wine bar we wanted to go to was too crowded.  The decor was pretty cheesy but at least it was pretty chill...we were able to get seats at the bar pretty easily, and they had fight club playing on one of their TVs.

The drinks were pretty decent...my first drink was some sweet berry-like thing, but I enjoyed my second drink more, it kind of tasted like a pina colada and was served in a fake coconut..

Not sure if I'll ever be back, but we had a nice chill time and there are worse choices in North Beach
author: Arlene M.

description: A little "G-Rated" watering hole in the midst of San Francisco's Strip District on Broadway in North Beach.
author: Ryan B.

description: The atmosphere of the bar is pretty solid, making for a great place to chill and get away from it all; however, there were two big downfalls, first all three of the drinks we ordered were way too sweet. Yes, it's a tropical theme, but in my adventures to the Pacific I've never had that sugary of a drink. Second the door to the single use men's room is broken which does not allow you the comfort of privacy when trying to take care of your business.
author: Daniel H.

description: This review is all about the people at the Bamboo Hut. They were, in a word, fantastic. Some guy walked off with my backpack at the bar, which had my brand new laptop in it. I walked out and asked the bouncer if he had noticed anyone walk off with it, wholly expecting a nope, already cursing myself for letting it out of sight... and the guy says yeah, I did. Not just that, he knew the guy. He went in to the bartender and they dug up his number (apparently he was a regular). Couldn't get a hold of him, so they gave me the manager's card. The manager Mario followed up, called me the next day, said he had called the guy too, and he was going to text me when he had my backpack back. And he did. I came by and collected it the next day. And Mario apologized for any inconvenience to me! This was on a Friday night. This place was hopping, busy, lots of drinks flowing. The bouncer, bartender, manager didn't have to help out... but they did. They went out of their way to help me, and I was a first-time customer there. I'm definitely going back - if only to patronize a place that cares!!!
author: M N.

description:
To do it right: $15

The awesomeness of this place cannot properly be put into text, but I'll try to highlight:
1. It's close to House of Nanking.
2. It's on the "colorful" border of North Beach.
3. Giant flaming bowls of delicious booze.

At Bamboo Hut, your order can literally be: One blended drink in that bowl, on fire, and delicious.  It is so, so great.  Also, inside tip, string 3 straws together so that you don't have to lean in to drink

The downside: not much of an ambiance.  However, the locale is ideal for pre- or post-partying.

Summary: Giant, flaming bowls of delicious boozeness that are great for sharing.  Pray to the tiki god.
author: Troy M.

description: I came here last night with my girls for my birthday and I loved it. The atmosphere and music give out great vibes and don't even get me started on my drinks. I love Mario the bartender! I've never had such a great bartender like him. He takes great pride in his craft and I enjoyed seeing him create special drinks for me. I didn't try any drinks from the other bartenders but he had he sold completely.
author: Andrea O.

description:
Wow, my first tiki tiki bar experience and it was awful. I had fun thanks to super fun friends and a fun drink...it was for a friend's birthday.

Location: Not my favorite location in San Francisco, the North Beach area. Don't drive here, you wont find parking. Straight people here are scary, scary, scary. Thank gawd there were lesbians and black people on the street to make me feel safer. There were also like 20 police on that block...weird, weird place. I felt like I was in a different world on that block. 

Space: The place gives the illusion of being big due to the mirror walls, but it's tiny tiny tiny. The decor scares me, it's like polynesian, meets tolteca, meets pacific islander mix, with angolan finnishes haha. 

Ambiance: The people were ugly, poorly dressed and couldn't dance for the life of them. My friends and I were awesome, though.

Service: Jesus, I asked for a dirty martini and she said, "What's that?" and then for a cosmopolitan and she said, "I don't know how to make that." 'Nuff said. She was nice though.

Food/Drink: I couldn't have my dirty martini...but we all shared this super fun volcano drink. It was pretty yummy and had fire on it.

Overall: This is usually the kind of place I stay away from but my sister wanted to go here for her birthday. Hopefully this will be the only time I am forced here...I am traumatized.
author: SF N.

description:
-the decor is very cheesy tiki style.  i like this.
-the bartenders are not dicks.  i like this.
