-that huge drink in all the pictures is tasty.  you get drunk slowly and barely realize it.  i like this.
-they have cheap buckets of beer in the bottle.  i like this.
-the alcohol isn't super watered down.  i like this.
-they have booths to sit in (but you have to get there a bit earlier in the night).  i like this.

-the people who seem to frequent this place are a bunch of douchey frat/sorority types.  i don't like this.
-they had the same half hour mix playlist (with NOTHING GOOD on it -top 40 autotune BS) repeating over and over the entire time we were there.  i don't like this.
-the aforementioned playlist was playing at like 20,000 decibels.  i don't like this.

my friend is in town for a semester and my boyfriend and i went with her to mingle with some of her schoolmates.  given the situation and the people we were there to hang out with, it was a good time.  however, would i return to hang out?  nah.  i'll walk 'round the block to Specs for some cheaper booze, battleship, and gouda cheese on saltines.  personally, that's much more my speed.  all in all, the place is cute and would be TOTALLY awesome if all the lame-os in SF didn't crowd it.
author: Beccie F.

description: Stopped here after not getting any good service at the bar across the street.  This bar is a little dive and it was perfect to sit back and watch the Giants game at.  Bartendar was super nice and even made us a few shots that we were looking up online.  Prices were reasonable.
author: Jen D.

description:
From the stories of folks my parent's age, there used to be a lot more tiki bars in the city. As this place is one of the last few of a dying breed, I feel as though there is much they can do to pump up the old tiki attitude - you know, torches, glass top bar, sand, cheesy don ho / blue hawaii slide guitar music, that whole bit! I mean come on, it's not like there's a whole lot of space to fill...

The drinks were alright though. Can't complain about the wide variety of creative concoctions on their specialty menu.
author: Alex B.

description:
I think I'm a REPUBLICAN.  I was previously under the impression that I was NOT a Republican, but a recent visit to the Bamboo Hut made me question my political identity.

Oh, this is not because I've suddenly seen the logic in abstinence based sex education or am now considering joining the NRA (both of which reasonably COULD happen after a Saturday night in North Beach).  No, I'm questioning my political identity because I felt pretty comfortable in the Bamboo Hut even though it was populated by what appeared to be members of the Republican caucus.

The men's uniform: Striped shirts!  Khaki pants!  

The women's uniform: Ann Taylor! (or maybe J Crew?)

The music: the play list from my jr. high and high school dances. (I vaguely recall dancing to Guns n Roses?).  Ok, no Funky Cold Medina, but we got there late, so it COULD have been played earlier.

The signature drink:  The FLAMING VOLCANO which does involve actual fire and is basically a LOT of alcohol mixed in a BLENDER!

The tiny dance floor: BLAZING whiteness in both appearance and technique!  Woooo-Hoooo!

The bartender: Apparently, not a believer in a welfare state as there were NO FREE DRINKS.  However, Mr. Bartender was also the nicest, most pleasant bartender in recent experience --- think Mr. Rogers the bartender.

Like I said, I felt pretty comfortable here.  I'm voting four stars.
author: Alannah T.

description:
NEW and IMPROVED drink menu! I highly suggest giving this place a second look if you have not been for a while!  A refreshing escape from the otherwise ghetto-tastic Broadway street. Chris and Nate will take care of you trust me !  

get the zombie!
author: David R.

description:
Okay, so let me make sure I have this right. 

In the Bay Area we have the Tonga Room, Trader Sams, Trader Vics, Trader Vics again, Trader Vics yet again, Hawaii West, Forbidden Island, Kona Club, Conga Lounge, the patio at Club Mallard, Temple Tiki Bar and Restaurant, Martini Monkey, Smoke Tiki Lounge and last but not least Bamboo Hut.

All decent bars if you like the tiki thing. All serve sweet drinks with umbrellas. Some have bad music, some have good music, some I just cant seem to remember the music. 

This particular tiki bar is small and a bit divey. It is more Hanalei than Honolulu. It neither falls into the bad nor good music category because it varies depending on the night. It definitely falls into the hangover category. The drinks here are just as likely to make you puke as all of the other tiki places that serve you what essentially amounts to alcoholic kool aid. 

It's sort of amazing, all of these drinking establishments with a tiki theme. Maybe I am not actually in NorCal. Maybe I have had one too many Hurricanes or Scorpion Bowls in my time and actually stumbled all the way to the Islands. 

I do seem to recall that the Bamboo Hut IS the temperature and humidity of the tropics when its crowded, which it is on the weekends, typical North Beach style (the reason for the lower rating). So, remember to wear a coconut bra (or, of you are a guy, coconut bro) and a grass skirt.
author: Drue C.

description:
Two words:  SCORPION    BOWL

3 more words:         F.   U.c.      k. e.d       m.E               U.           P.



Why do your scorpion bowls taste like sweet sweet lollipops?
Why is there only ONE ladies bathroom?
Why was someone doing lines of coke off the toilet seat?
Why didn't she lock the god damn door?
Why is there no coat hooks underneath the bar?


Bamboo Hut got me drunk from 0 to 60 in about 30 seconds flat.
I.          h.[e]a[r]t[e].         y.  o.            u.



p.s. Why is Bamboo Hut located under the category: Day Spa?
         There was no fucking day spa to be found at this location.
         Only scorpion bowls and seedy chode-bags.
author: MJ T.

description: Off the Grid, small island themed bar in the madness of the B&T North Beach Clubs that dominate Broadway. Drinks are strong and cheap, bartenders are always friendly and the crowd is eclectic.Good for day drinking, solo-drinking or if you are actually trying to get into a North Beach Club and can't get in
author: Craig S.

description:
Flaming volcano bowls filled with deliciousness. Look at the pics. 

A modern day "jukebox" in which you can request backstreet boys among many other of my teen favs! Drunkenly singing to BSB, Nsync, Britney. Amazing. 

"Characters" walking the streets in North Beach to judge on your drunken walk/taxi cab ride home. 

Yes, yes, yes! All in a good night out!
author: Nicolle M.

description:
VOLCANO BOWL!!!!

VOLCANO BOWL!!

VOLCANO BOWL.

Need I say more?

Well, I'll add a little more so that it'll meet my Yelping standards (which are not very high).

You leave the bustling streets outside and end up in a tiki hut!  

A creeper with long hair follows you and your friends around for a while.  "You guys are hot", he says drunkenly.

Well, he's totally harmless - after all, you're at Bamboo Hut to HAVE FUN and accordingly GET EFF'D UP!  

You know what that means, right?

VOLCANO BOWL!!!

VOLCANO BOWLL!

VOLCANO BOWL!

Well the thing you do to GET EFF'D UP is get a couple of these with your friends in addition to your shots and WIDE RANGE of mixed drinks with quaint names that Bamboo Hut has to offer.

Then you get up and dance yo' ass off to their interesting music selection that consists of 90's hip hop and 90's rock (at least on the night that I was there).  The song transitions will be awkward, but for whatever reason it adds to the atmosphere.  Every song change is an explosion of awesomeness and anticipation, because you never know what freakishly random song will be played next.

The crowd is fun and friendly, particularly on nights when the SF Giants win the NLCS ;).

I know they are friendly because my friends were crowded together in Bamboo Hut, merely EXISTING, when a nice girl walks over to us and says, "You guys rule!" with her thumbs-up.  She also later asked to take pictures with us.

This place is just pure fun.  A great crowd and everyone is there to chillax or get really drunk or meet nice people and possibly take someone home, but I'll mentally leave that one out for now.

The bathroom could use some work.  Just FYI, this is the type of place where a lot of throwup gets cleaned every night...lol.  

You know what they say, right?

PARTY AIN'T CRACKIN' TILL SOMEBODY YACKIN'!!!

And just for good measure:

VOLCANO BOWL!!!!!!

VOLCANO BOWL!!

Volcano bowl.
author: M Y.

description:
So all you want to do is quickly forget that you went to Dragon Bar - and I mean QUICKLY...In point of fact, you want to forget the trip to Dragon bar ever happened because you are feeling physically violated - erasing it from your permanent record is probably closer to the true desire...Now if you're following the story you know our hero feels violated, not because he had to pay an obscene cover to get into Dragon Bar and not because he had to wait in a huge line but violated because some not so attractive B&T chick with the grip of steel gave said author a package check that probably bruised the twins (See Dragon Bar review for all of this to make sense or just roll with it) and induced a stomach ache the second he hit the door...this of course, threw off your evening like only a package check from an unattractive girl with man hands can...

Thankfully, me being the lush that I am and knowing my bars like I do, I had to look no further than right next door for help - Bamboo Hut (otherwise know as 'The Hut') is the place to make all those bad memories a little bit, or a lot, fuzzier (NOTE: If you are an experienced drink or an amateur with a death wish you can do this very quickly by applying a Flaming Volcano Bowl or two to the liver - WARNING this is not a smart thing to do but be sure your friends get pictures afterward as you will not remember any of the truly humorous things that you will do or exactly who or what you did them to or with)...there is nothing like a Tiki Bar to take the edge off...Bamboo Hut feels like a throw back to the days of Blue Hawaii...The throwback music coupled with a great bar staff make this a great place to go and throw back a few Mai Tai's...

Yes, it does get packed and yes, sometimes crowd is a bit of an annoyance but it's always a good solid place to go and get your drunk on if you're on Broadway and you don't want to deal with the typical pretentious BS at the typical over-hyped places...
author: Todd E.

description: The only thing missing from this place is Lovey and Thurston Howell, III, relaxing @ the tiki bar whilst sipping cocktails. It's kitschy, inexpensive (for happy hour, at least), and an excellent place to bring or meet up with a group of friends. And with all of the tropical drinkie options, you can catch a buzz AND stave off the scurvy and rickets at the same time!
author: Gregor G.

description:
I suppose it's about time I chimed in on this place as I have been there just about every week since it opened 9 some years ago. The hut has a long sordid history and I have seen most of it. Hell, I have been some of it!

First off, this place is fun. It's super cheesy so if you don't have a sense of humor go somewhere else. This place is made for cutting loose, having fun and letting go. Recently under new management by Nick (who kicks ass) and now Marshal (who also kicks ass), the place is undergoing another paradigm shift with new theme nights and a fresh attitude toward making it the place to be on Broadway. Frankly the rest of the once jumping street has basically gone to hell in a hand basket. 

There's a new rocking happy hour, new drinks, always new people and generally a great time to be had. It's a get what you give kind of place so if you are an asshole expect to be treated accordingly (which I think should be true everywhere) but if you are there because you are looking to have fun then fun you will have.

And if you are a first timer, get the Volcano Bowl. Come on, just do it, you know you like to see drinks on fire!
author: Brady T.

description:
How shall I word this??
 
Three friends and I entered this rather divey bar as our last stop for the evening, after a full night of drinking around North Beach.
I asked the bartender what she is good at making, and she said, "Anything tropical!"  That automatically brings Pina Coladas to my mind, so I picked that, and then so did everyone else.
 
Three minutes later, we had four Pina Coladas before us, delicious as promised, in large, fake coconut jugs.
We all hollered, "ONE SHOT" and downed them all and gave ourselves severe brain and lung freeze instantly.

For kicks.
 
Ouch.
 
And then we did one more round of ONE SHOT PINA COLADAS, declared it a night, and went home.

Good times!
author: Grace K.

description:
Came here for NYE celebration. A friend of a friend rented out the place and of course opened up the list for the maximum guest of 100. Although me and my friends had to walk to the bar from the Montgomery BART station, it was nice to not be in a overcrowded bar for NYE. 

The drinks were good and the service is awesome. There was one bartender who totally took care of our group. Definitely a great NYE place to party. Especially when me and my friend did the Pee-Wee Herman 'Tequila' dance on the bar. Although there is not a lot of sitting space, I still like the vibe of this place.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Yup, 5 stars to a tiki dive bar directly adjacent to a strip club. My mama would be so proud. 

But really, when you want a tropical beverage, this is your place. Drinks are cheap and ridiculous. The four of us started off our day by splitting a Scorpion bowl: 151-infused rum slushy punch. By far, the most potent $12 I've ever taken part of (non-happy hour price, $16). The bartender was laid back and friendly; and for some reason, all four patrons at the bar cheered when we peeked in the door and welcomed us in. 

Completely random, and completely wonderful.
author: Erin M.

description:
I haven't been to the Hut in a while..... I always remember having a great time!!!
I recommend the Volcano drink if you're out with a group, it's awesome and HUGE!!!! I believe they light it on fire too!!!!

Good times!

Now that I know they have made some improvements, I will have to go check it out again soon!
author: K P.

description:
I used to LOOOOVE going to the Bamboo Hut in my younger days: fruity beverages at reasonable prices, good location, fun atmosphere (albeit a bit on the small side), usually good tunes spinning, draws a fun crowd, awesome bartenders... all the good ingredients for a great bar.  Many memories have been made here, like the time I kissed a sailor... hum, make that two sailors, during fleet week.  Then there was the British boy I met there.  Oh, and too many birthday celebrations to count (no, they weren't all mine).  

I hadn't been in years and decided to hit "The Hut" up for Friday Happy Hour.  I walked in with two girlfriends who I totally built this place up to... and the joint was completely empty!  What happened to the crowd that I remembered the Hut attracting for happy hour?!?  It was a fun experience none the less... our fabulous (and cute!) bartender, Tim (I think that was his name, the drink clouded my memory), mixed us up one of their deadly volcano bowls which helped us get the night going in style.  He would even come over and re-light the 151 floater when the flames extinguished... now that's service!  Conclusion: The Hut doesn't seem to be quite the place I remember it as... but like an old friend, I will not give up on it and promise my loyalty for all the good times it has given me in the past.
author: Ms. M. M.

description: $5 cover. First thing as I walk in is a girl on all fours on the dance floor (to a Bloodhound Gang song). It's too damn crowded and the bathroom reeks of old, stale urine. Only saving grace is that the drinks are mixed ok. Also to their credit they play a variety of decent music. Okay. I went to the bar with Marsha Z. and she was right... Drinks were served pretty quickly unlike other bars that take a million years before you can get their attention even if you stare at them.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Very nice dark laid back place to hang out. There is a friendly crowd there when I went, which was a saturday night. The one thing you have to try is the large tiki bowls. I think its a volcano bowl. Good liqure in there. btw, blow out the flame before all the 151 disappears!
author: Joshua F.

description:
Why the hell do I always get in trouble at the Hut?  And who the f**k let someone in with a digital camera last time?

Fun, unpretentious most of the time and with some of the politest bartenders on the whole Broadway strip - the Bamboo Hut is great for silly good times.  Not a trolling bar and not really a dance club.  But fun!

Warning - you must be able to stand large doses of 80's/metal/early 90's music.  If you cannot, go to another club as this one will merely frustrate you.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
In an attempt to outdo myself for my last theme picked bar, butter, I selected Bamboo Hut this Friday night. I don't think I outdid myself, but the flaming volcano did some of us in.

Having frequented Trader Sam's, who serves their scorpion in a restaurant supply store plastic bowl. Think Sizzler jello salad bowl, circa 1989. I appreciated the festive volcano bowl the uber sized flamer was served in. $19, price tag, liquor included.

I admit it, I contemplated attempting to get out the door with it. After all I've more that completed my pint glass collection, pretty much finished off my branded jelly jar drink glass souvenir line. I need another useless drink glass collection starter hobby. Opting to respect the integrity of my Coach handbag that night I satisfied myself with the bartenders number, another collection, and headed off to my local IR bar.
author: Jenny T.

description:
YAY! It seems I love "huts." They attract me.

High fives for all their bar tenders, esp Lauren, since that's pretty much who we come to see. The place can get packed, gets a little cozy, but fun and 100% bar experience. Great DJ's & music. If you're looking for a pub or a club, this isn't your place, since it's a TIKI BAR. Some of the sour reviews below amaze me.

Yes, I have:
*blacked out from a night of fun here
*puked from a night of fun here
*suffered my first really painful hangover after a night of fun here
*witnessed great pukes & black outs from a night of fun here &
*started collecting awesome personal stories thanks to Bamboo Hut.

If you know how to have a good time, you'll have a blast here!
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Tonight I met up with a few folks at this place. I am definately not impressed. Although the bartender is great (she does an excellent job) and the music is great, this place is just too dirty for my taste:
 - Bar stools are loose, some need to be replaced
 - The padding on the barstools are stained with God only knows what
 - The seating area around the table needs to be re apholstered
 - Smell of sulfur wafting into the establishment from the near by     
   manhole cover totally ruines the atmosphere
- Pictures posted on yelp of this place look alot better than the actual 
  place.

I saw a few people ordering food, personally, I cannot eat in a place that is dingy. As it turns out, the night I was here, they only had one menu for all it's guests, so...if you attend...be prepared to glance at the menu before the staff passes it onto another patron. 

Good Points:
- They have a cool blow fish lamp hanging up
- Great bartender
- Good music
author: Darrel D.

description: Cool/Fun!  However, that could be because I was with my BIS study group...really cool/fun people!  LoL
author: Ladi Da A.

description: This bar is the best!  I LOVE the Bamboo hut!  The flaming volcano bowl is the best mixed drink I have ever had.  I have been here on a few occasions and split this bowl with one other person.  Big trouble.  It is enough to split between 4 people.  I have left this place plastered and ended up on the streets of San Francisco not knowing where I am.  It is totally worth it though!  Nick, the bartender even taught me how to fire-blow and light my finger on fire safely!  I love this bar!
author: Allyson R.

description: I come here for awesome Mai Tais served by a bartender that looks like Taylor Lautner. You may find this bartender on a Friday night. Another night, I came here on their annual party where they covered the whole bar with sand. That night, I felt like I was back in the islands.
author: Helen L.

description:
It's the best Tiki bar in the city. I have been going to this bar since I was 21.  Wednesdays are my favorite nights because the place is a pretty much dead. It's perfects for a week night date, as long as you don't have to get up early the next day. They must put something in the rum because you can't ever have just one drink.  Saturdays are a  lot of fun too but nothing like a week night. It can get pretty crazy here on the weekends, I would go with the group. The only thing i don't like about this place is sometimes there can be some pretty creepy guys hanging around. I don't like the boys you the sideways baseball caps staring a my rack when in ordering a drink. Icky poo.

Update: Apparently if you are seen having to wait too long for you drink it just might be free! Also kudos on the photobooth!
author: Sharon M.

description:
So much better than I was expecting.  Not being a fan of bars with: a) a cover charge or b) people dressed like they are going to an exclusive club, I did not have positive expectations for this bar. But, the drinks were good and not that expensive, the DJ was spinning some great 80s and 90s tunes, and the crowd was much less obnoxious than I expected.

The drinks were a little on the weak side and the cover charge policy does not seem to apply across the board (I didn't have to pay, but someone else in our group did).  All in all, if I'm in North Beach drinking I would probably go here, but wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Rebecca H.

description: There signature bowl drink called the volcano bowl has an open flame in the middle of a decently tasting and decent EtOH strength fruity tasting slushy that includes 151 proof vodka. Today there was a $5 cover charge for the guys since there was a live country band playing. The seating area was ok as there were several circular cubicals that could probably fit 4-5 people. The bathrooms are kinda dirty and the guys bathroom doesnt lock so deucing is not recommended.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Throwback music is right.  But no Don Ho; boo.

The Bamboo Hut makes an okay pina colada, but the flaming volcano bowl is better than the average Deadly Tiki-Bar Bowl.  It's big, it comes in your standard opaque thing, but it's ON FIRE, and it reliably gets the pathetic drinker-victims completely trashed.  

I go here at most three times a year.  All three are pub crawls.  One involves Santa hats, one bunny ears, and the third either a golf getup or a grass skirt (usually).  We go, take the place over for about 90 minutes, do a few group photos and then leave.  in the meantime there's dice and video games.  It's like someone's parents' rec room after they've been gone for two weeks.  

If you're going to show up here on a Friday night, do yourself a favor and call first.  "Is a giant herd of bunnies hopping through there tonight?" would be a good question to ask.
author: Anne B.

description: The bamboo hut is awesome! It's comfortable, and friendly, and a real gem tucked away amongst the smut on Broadway.  It  is a lot nicer and cleaner there than the rest of Broadway, but depending on the night you still might get a little spice.  My coworkers and I regularly go see Mimi... she is always a pleasure, and can make a mean drink... after such great service we've ended up going on multiple nights, and it turns out all the bartenders there are great.  Certainly one of my favorite places, pretty relaxed on the weekdays, and a party on the weekends.
author: Deanna W.

description:
Every time I go into this place I have a blast.  The joint is small and the music is hit-or-miss, but...

We randomly rolled in here one summer night and fell into a pimps and hoes (sp?) birthday party.  The ladies were looking scandalous and the men were dressed in their pimped-out finery.  We get in there at around 10pm and everyone is nicely drunk.  We need to catch up... and catch up FAST!  A couple of Jager Bombs will take care of that.

Strolling to the back, I see the most beautiful - and least dressed - girl in the bar.  I was barely drunk, so I'm convinced she was actually a goddess and wold look great if she was fully covered.  I need an in...

"What's with the costumes?  Is there a private party going on tonight?"
(Note:  NEVER say this to a stranger unless you are already sure they are in costume.)
"It's a birthday party... why are you not dressed as a pimp?"
"I'm under cover.  Besides, pimpin is in the heart, not the clothes."
"Hahaha!  Do you guys know the birthday boy?"
"No, where is..."
"HEY!" A shout from the back of the room.  Apparently, the goddess' boyfriend was unhappy with her talking with us.  She goes back there, and is scolded and sits down, completely dejected, next to this punk (who was, I suspect, invited, but failed to put his pimp gear on).

I continue to chill, looking back at her every little while, knowing he was watching me watching her.  Finally, the fool goes to the restroom.  As soon as he rounds the corner, she jumps up and re-joins her friends.  Finally, though discreet trespass and almost imperceptible shifts in position, I find myself standing beside her once more.

"Jees.  Can you get rid of this guy (nodding towards the restroom)?  He's bringing me down."
"Sure.  Does he need cab fare."  In my mind I'm doing the calculation... Walnut Creek is far enough... about $100 away.  She laughs and is about to respond, but he returns from the restroom (you KNOW a guy like that doesn't wash his hands) so they again retire to the back of the room.

"Dude" I say to my friend, "we need to take that guy out."
"I'm with you, but he's pretty big."
"No problem, I'll just hit him with this beer bottle."
He looks closely at our soon-to-be victim...
"He's got a varsity wrestling jacket on... it might take two."
"How about this fire extinguisher?"
As I'm looking at the locking mechanism, trying to discover how to get it off the wall, they leave.  Ah well, it would have been pretty messy in here.  Kinda like fighting King Kong:  Hit him with the extinguisher, grab his girl and run like hell.

Once they left, I was able to see that a really great party was talking place all around me.  The perfect 10 was gone, but a room full of 9s ain't bad.
My buddy latches onto a fine girl in a nano-mini.  They start getting close and I see her whisper into his ear.  He says something back and she gets even closer.  Nice work, my man!  Later, he comes by and tells me about the conversation:
"I have something to tell you, but I don't know how"
"It's cool, just go ahead an say it"
"Well, it's just that I'm... I mean I like.... I'm a lesbian."
"Hmmm.  That's cool."

The fact that this knowledge did not slow him down for a minute turned her on even more.  Every time I looked over, his hands were places polite society will not let me mention in this post.

Oh yeah... this is supposed to be a review of the bar.  Good service, friendly staff.  Bouncers are not pricks when it's time to clear the place at the end of the night.  I'll be back.
author: Anthony R.

description:
While the 5$ is a drag, I have to give this place 4 stars because I had such a fucking great time here on my birthday. First thing to understand about the Bamboo Hut - Go in a GROUP! The kitsch interior will be better, the booze will be better, the music won't be as bad, etc., etc. Also, the nice folks at the bar waived the cover for everyone in my party. That's probably because I'm so charming, but I would guess at least some of you are also.

Seriously though, as a jumping off point for a group friends hitting the town hard, flaming booze in the back room is hard to beat. Among a group of cynical bon vivants, everyone managed to have a good time. The only real problem is when I stood up on the bench with a volcano bowl in each hand in order to summon the TIKI GODS of FIRE!! I'm almost fell and spilled flaming booze on 20 of my best friends. Thanks to my ninja-like reflexes, they were spared that fate.
author: Jay N.

description:
THE BAMBOO HUT ROCKS.  End of story.

I've been coming to this bar since I turned 21... I'll be 29 soon.  I've always had a blast here... between the bartenders (who I've become friends with over the years), the awesome tiki decor, the cool DJs, and the fun music, you can't go wrong.  I've taken a BUNCH of different friends to the Hut over the years, and everyone's had a fun time.  My favorite night to go is Friday... LOVE going with some friends, talking to the bartenders, picking up women, dancing my ass off, and just having an overall BLAST.  Thursday nights are awesome too, with the rockin' sounds and rockabilly they play .  I love this bar, and have been to it more than any other bar I've ever been to.
author: Mondo B.

description:
Who knew that there was a poor man's Tonga Room nestled between North Beach strip clubs?  

We found this alcoholic tribute to all things Hawaiian kitsch to be a fun change up. I went straight for a MaiTai, which was delicious and ridiculous with a paper umbrella, however the flaming volcano bowl looks fantastic if you've got that kind of night in mind. The DJ, who holds court from a mini tiki booth played fantastic tunes on Saturday. Next time I need a tropical vacation STAT, I'll head right over to Bamboo Hut!
author: Kelly C.

description: Nice place to get a drink, with a nice hut looking atmosphere.  Not too crowded when it is early.  when I was there it wasn't too busy.  I like the staff there, they are nice.  There is also a DJ there as well.  I would say that the only bad thing around the broadway area is parking.  Get there early so you can find street parking otherwise it is hard to find as the night goes.  If you pay at the lot it is $15 dollars and they only take cash.  They have good tropical drinks at this location.
author: Alice T.

description:
Fun, fun, fun!

This place oozes with wicked drinks, fab music and uber cool funky people who know how to get down and dance.  Every time I enter this bar I have so much fun I leave feeling giddy and like I've shed ten years.  The drinks are pretty to look at and are very tasty.  The people are ridiculous and know how to shake their butts whether it's to Madonna or Snoop.

The space is a bit tight but the tikki vibe will make you feel like you're vacationing and you might not mind it as much.

Oh and don't miss out on the big "bowl drink" with the fire in the middle.  It's jumbo size and served w/about six straws, totally delicious and worth every penny.
author: Swetha G.

description:
I came in here during a friday happy hour with my friend and the place was pretty empty for the time of day/week.  My friend and I split a Volcano Bowl and I must say...Wow!  For $12 you get a massive bowl of rum and fruit set on fire (the bartender came very close to letting the lit rum spill onto the bat, which he said actually has happened on occasion.  It is definitely a place worth checking out with a few friends and splitting a Volcano.  
From reading reviews on Yelp, I thought the Happy Hour special was $4 drinks so I decided to go nuts and get a zombie.  I was a little shocked to hear the $10 price tag.  I then learned that the happy hour is $2 off drinks, and Zombies are normally $12, fair enough, now I know better.  For the extra $2 I am sticking with Volcanoes from now on.  I am from Alameda so I have been spoiled by the deliciously well crafted tropical drinks they make at Forbidden Island so I was a little dissapointed in the Zombie that I had.  It was strong as hell, but not what I was expecting, basically a tropical Long Island Iced Tea (Big Island Iced Tea?)
I will have to check out Smuggler's Cove to determine where my new Tiki bar in the city is going to be, but Bamboo Hut definitely serves its purpose.
author: Scott G.

description:
This place was okay. I noticed that Yelp reviewers really love their dive bars. I don't think it deserves 4 stars, and definitely not 5. It was just okay. 

Fairly diverse crowd. No cover is a plus. Old school hip hop earlier in the night, random "classic rock" towards the end. Bouncers were nice, but then again I have boobs so they usually are. Outside looks kinda sketch, but who knew that inside wouldn't be so terrible. 

It's funny that with all the mirrors, the place does a really good job of pretending to be wayy bigger than it is...
author: Leily P.

description:
When I walked into this establishment Guns n Roses Welcome to the Jungle was blaring throughout the straw covered walls. If that's not the song to start your Friday night out right then I don't know what is.

In a drunken flurry I saw flaming bowls of alcohol. Watching the bartender make this amazing concoction, he stuck his finger in the blazing pot of 151 and flipped off my friend for the perfect photo-op.

The funky jams kept playing all night long, and the dancing ensued. All the of the staff were super fun, from the DJ to the doormen. The lady bartender was amazing, supply me and my friend with shots all night! 

Very cool place tucked away in the hot mess of Broadway.
author: Kara S.

description: Always delighted to head to the Bamboo Hut whenever I'm in North Beach.  It's certainly a unique bar with the fun tikki layout, the crowd is a good mix and the bartenders are a lot of fun.  The DJ pumps up the crowd and it's an awesome place, especially when people start dancing.  By far my favorite bar in North Beach.
author: Captain J.

description:
How can you not like the Bamboo Hut? I have many good memories, mini vacation nights, birthdays, bachelorette parties, at the Bamboo Hut. You can't help but feel like you're away on an island. The drinks are fun! We had a few chi chis, which are made with vodka (I can't drink rum).

As usual, there were your run of the mills db's, but isn't that better than mission hipsters? 

The beer selection is limited; I recommend going for a fun tropical drink!
author: Melissa A.

description:
I love this place. I love this place...Ill say it again I love this place.

 Okay Pina Colodas are hard to find in this city. Noone wants to dig out the blender and try and find all the garneshes. I need a paper umbrella in my Pina to call it a colada. 

Anyway...this place not only makes me feel like Im in the jungle in a third world country but also has the best Pina Colada Ive had in San Francisco. They let you play your own music (if you happen to have your Ipod with you) when theres no Dj.  Serve tropical drinks, and sing alone to "The Promise" by When in rome with you after your smashed.

 The street traffic is ridiculous so theres never a shortage of strange travelers or locals coming in to spice it up. Its totally the kind of place you could swing from the rafters and dance on the bar after one to many and they would more than likely kick you out and then hug you when you came back the next day.  I like that in a bar....I really do.

Luv ya...keep sending the Pina Coladas to the wasted girl on the end of the bar.

Thanks
author: Charlie B.

description:
This is the BESTEST place for SF Bay Area locals to come hang out with friends and meet new ones!

Every Thursday the Bamboo Hut features 50s rock n roll, RnB, surf, exoctica and other Savage Sounds with resident DJs Miss Cherry Bomb and Dr. Scott.

Lovely Lauren pours your favorite spirits behind the bar and Nick welcomes you at the door!

Come celebrate your birthday, bacchelorette or bachelor party with us!
author: Ann M.

description:
What an amazing bar. When I first walked in, I was speechless. 
The tiki decor was done right, which I can't say for most tiki bars I've been to. The staff was great, not to forget about the stiff drinks that was served to me. If I didn't live 400 miles away, I would be there weekly. So please come and support the Bamboo Hut, theres not many places like this anymore.  Say hello to the beautiful Lauren working the bar. I miss you guys!
Hope to see ya soon.
author: James M.

description: So far this is among the worst bars I've been to in SF, and that's saying a lot. It's really small so good luck getting a seat. The "dance floor" is 1/2 the size of my living room. I had to laugh out loud when the guy at the door told me there was a cover charge. The ladies I was with decribed the crowd as shady; the vibe was like we were at some ghetto frat party. The bartender was way, way more interested in dancing by himself behind the bar than actually pouring drinks. Speaking of drinks - every one I had was watered down beyond belief. The dancing douchetender completely filled my glass with Grey Goose and added a splash of cranberry, and I could barely taste the vodka. Do yourself a favor and go to one of the strip clubs across the street. You'll have a terrible experience but it'll still be a better time than this place.
author: Jack S.

description:
Tiki room bliss! 

All I have is good things to say about this place...it's like walking into a tropical tiki paradise. Sure you can find a floating wedding singer band at the Tonga Room, but Bamboo Hut RULES!!! The ambiance is warm and inviting, totally themed, and cozy, intimate yet not cramped,. There's even a special private room in the back for big private parties if you wanna get wild with your scorpian bowl drinks set afire!

I loooove the weekend bartender Lauren- sweet as pie, and willing to make and serve you your poison of choice- always smiling! I highly recommend their specialty tropical cocktails. 

I go on Thursdays for the "Night of the savage sounds", where they have resident and featured DJ's spinning old school rock and roll, swing, surf, and blues. It's definitely one of the most comfortable no drama bars in North Beach, and is starting to become one of my favorite bars in the city - well especially on Thursdays! 

It's hard to find a chill bar with a friendly atmosphere these days...Bamboo has all these things, and a uniqueness no other place has, from the staff, to the decor(where else are ya gonna see blowfish hanging from the ceiling and a 12 foot tiki??!), yummy fruity drinks, and awesome people that frequent the joint!
author: jena d.

description:
The only thing "working" the night I was there was me!  The place had great jams, some hot sweaty horny nerds and well, ME!  Until I got there, the party hadn't started.  

The faux, crappy lava stuff is broken.  The waterfall was empty and therefore, not flowing.  The drinks had no alcohol, the guys no game.  The bartenders were , eh, the tunes okay.  The bouncers were LAME and the only reason I'd go back was that there were plenty of fun drunk arse guys to dance with and that's it.

Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description:
all i can say - volcano bowls. where else can you get a huge flaming drink and share with your friends?

i also am a huge fan of when they truck in the sand during the summer. if only the weather was hotter it would be like hawaii..
author: laura f.

description:
Bamboo Hut is the perfect place to drink beers on the cheap while waiting for your table at Tomasso's around the corner. Honestly it is exactly what you need in a recession.  

For those who knock it because your $300 jeans don't stand out here...  you are at the wrong place! Buy a bucket of Dos XXs for $20 and you'll think of yourself as the world's most interesting man.
author: Nigel E. S.

description:
So we went here for my early birthday/graduation/going-away party a few weeks ago, and yeah, I had fun.  The music was absolutely ridiculous in that awful-amazing kind of way, and really, you can't go wrong when drinks are served in plastic coconut husks, right?  The bouncers were perfectly sleazy, winking at me and letting me know that i owed them, later of course.

I really just love that it's tacky inside.  It  hurts my eyes.  That's a good thing.

The crowd was kind of eh.  Random, and just eh.  And I really hated when the bachelorette  girl came in.  I was like "HAY I AM THE CENTER OF ATTENTION TONIGHT, NOT YOU!"  Then I ruined my brand new phone.  OOPSIE.
author: Angela H.

description: Stumbled in to this place with some friends recently after a trip at Centerfold. A little tiki bar that breaks up the monotony of strip clubs and porn shops on the SF Broadway strip. The decor is funny and the vibe is fun, next time I'll be sure to try their signature Volcano Bowl.
author: Jaide K.

description:
Friday Night = Thumbs Down

I'd rather be beat with a bamboo stick than be here. Nobody was there & we paid a cover too.  Enough said.  Off to Dragon Bar.  Maybe another night won't be so Hutorrible.
author: Po L.

description:
Cool decor, AWESOME bartenders! Especially the ones who helped me recover my iPhone! God! Thought that thing had bit the bust for the final time.
Been here a couple times, since I used to work across the street, and even a couple times after. The first time was to see Thee Swank Bastards, and I think the second and third times it was to see them as well.
The last time I went, or rather, the time right before the last time, I was hammered beyond a reasonable doubt, hustling some poor fellow for whiskey shots. Somewhere in the midst of the night I misplaced my phone, and called them the next morning (after I cried my eyes out and threw a temper tantrum upon realization) and left a message, hoping some kind soul MIGHT have turned it in... but it's reality, right? I wasn't expecting SHIT. That shit was GONE. I was already about to roll my pennies and call AT&T about a new one.
Well I called, left a message, and they called me back... Chris it was, I believe. I go in and recover it... a cute punk-ISH looking chick named Mimi was working behind the bar and she gave me back my phone and I decided to stay and have a couple vodka sodas and relinquish the night. We shoot the shit, smoke cigs and sample delicious mixed shots that tasted like fruit rollups. Very comfortable, easy going place with seemingly easy going people. 4 stars because it is out in North Beach which is going to limit my going there to 0-2x  a month, probably. Haha.
author: Liane V.

description:
I look at the cocktail menu...

"Could be pink... could be pink... probably pink... definitely pink.  Hmm, tropical margarita."

Doesn't say what's in it, so I just cross my fingers and order it, along with drinks for the gf and a friend.  So, the bartender goes to work mixing up the cabana coolers and bamboo busters, or whatever they ordered.  I look back and she's pouring the first drink: PINK... son of a bitch.  I continue you my conversation and when I look back the second drink is being poured INTO A COCONUT... oh great, that's much better.  Now I watch intently as she makes the third, willing her with mind as she grabbed bottle after bottle.  

"Not the grenadine!  Stay away from that cranberry juice!"

In the end it ended up a nice pale green, and after reassurance that is was in fact mine, i gladly passed the pinko and the coconut to my compadres.
author: Trevor F.

description:
The drinks are on fire (literally), the music is awesomely bad, and the bartenders rock! 

At least this is what I can remember--too many flaming volcano bowls!

Can't wait to go back!
author: Wendy G.

description: I love this bar. I checked it out for the first time on a Wednesday evening during happy hour. There was hardly anyone inside. I was expecting a dumpy dive, but this is actually a nice bar with clean bathrooms! There is a lot of seating, and comfy booths. The bartender was very friendly and my 3 friends and I got a good buzz going from 2 of the $12 happy hour volcano bowls. I should note, I once went to the Tonga room and was disappointed to find this supposed "institution" had NOT ONE flaming drink, the hallmark of a good tiki bar. So, Bamboo Hut delivers! To the people griping about the crowd, what do you expect in North Beach? Go on a weeknight after work and it won't resemble Jersey Shore.
author: Beth D.

description:
OK.  So it's faux beach party night at the Bamboo Hut and there's sand inside a bar in North Beach.  Sure.  I'm game.  Got some sand in my shoes.  That's OK.  Always glad to see some different new ideas to liven up the nightlife.

They have infamous Volcano Bowls, that are known in other places as Scorpion Bowls or some other tropical sounding thingamabob Bowl.  (i.e. Tons of hard alcohol is poured into a large bowl that is set on fire and many people drink together.)  I imagine it's some kind of group bonding alcohol abuse thing.  That's cool.  I'm open minded.

Anyways, I came, I saw, I limboed.  (And hurt my back.  Darn this aging process).  Anywhere that serves Tropical Tons of Alcohol Bowls gets at least three stars.  The fact that they'd do something kinda silly-fun like have a faux beach party gets them to four.
author: Aron L.

description: Fantastic! So much better than all the other lame bars in North Beach. Bartenders are awesome! No line on a Saturday night!
author: Chris W.

description: We stumble across this bar. First thing I notice was sand on the floor. It felt I was in a sandbox which was cool. The drinks were not bad. It does bring back the feeling of the islands. The music was good and I think a good place to go if you want to hang out or just get some sand in your shoes.
author: Donna Y.

description: I love the $4 happy hour with amazing tropical drinks. My office used to be right up the street from Bamboo Hut before I changed jobs so it was often a go-to happy hour spot. The decor is nice too though I feel bad for the real puffer fish that were used to make the tropical fish lights! Poor guys! I've gone a bit later at night too and it's always fun to share the big volcano bowl with a group. Reminds me of the scorpian bowls from college.... the music is typically alright at night but the crowd is super random and I think they sometimes try to charge a cover charge which seems a bit ridiculous to me for what is mostly a dive bar...
author: Meghan P.

description: I've only been here twice and found this dive bar hit or miss. First time was for happy hour on a Friday, and I enjoyed my pina colada. I liked it enough that I came back last night after film night at Washington Square Park. They charged a $5 cover, but the bouncer was nice enough to let us in for free. The bartender last night blended us horrible drinks - tasted like ice without alchohol or fruit. I'd stick to Trad'r Sam in Richmond for blended tiki drinks from now on. 2-3 stars.
author: Diana B.

description:
I had my birthday party there this past weekend and it was fantastic. I went Jersey Shore themed, and the GM was more than happy to help me theme the bar after the JS--we developed a themed drink menu, there were cast photos on the bar...it was great. The only requirement was that we meet a $600 bar tab for renting the entire place from 7-10 on a Saturday night (which we did, ahem, handily)--I couldn't have asked for a better venue! 

I have to deduct one star for the fact that the bouncer started letting streams of people in at 9:30, when I had reserved the place until 10. Pretty annoying, but the rest of the night was so great, I'll let it slide.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
Maybe it is my interest in the culture and style of the 1940s and 1950s, maybe it is my desire to be on the beach, or maybe it is my fascination with Pacific Island culture, but there is something wonderful about Tiki bars. A good Tiki bar is a thing of beauty, somewhere that takes you away from where you are and brings you to the beach in Hawaii.  Bamboo Hut does just that in wonderful, divey fashion.

Coming on the recommendation of the bartender, Thunder, at Mr. Smiths in SOMA, we were told to deliver a note to the Hut's bartender, Marshall.  When we arrived, we greeted ourselves and passed on the note, which certainly added a bit of levity to the evening.  

A fairly somber Wednesday night was made much better with the great atmosphere, the fantastic DJ (his mash-ups were top notch) and an interesting group of patrons).  Definitely a great bar that I am looking forward to returning to.
author: Eric M.

description:
Great drinks! Good times!

Bamboo Hut is a great place to chill or to simply get your drink on. This place makes you feel like you are drinking on an island pub. I've heard that this place is filled with sand sometimes but when I went for my first time I was sadly disappointed to find that there was no sand.

The bartenders are great. They make delicious and strong drinks. Highly recommend the specials which include the volcano bowl (meant to be shared by at least 4 people) or the witch doctor.

Warning. The place is quite small. Almost a hole in the wall. Get there early to score a booth or you will be standing up all night.
author: David W.

description: My friend said she had, "the worst time" here but I don't remember much about it after thinking, "$5 pina colada is straight booze."
author: Dinner Dog X.

description:
Only a few bars will get me out of my neighborhood and this is one of them.  NOT the typical Marina/Northbeach scene, despite it's location on Broadway.  It feels a lot more "real" San Francisco, possibly because I've know both of the doormen since I was about four.  

The drinks standard price for that 'hood.  I love some Tiki action and the music always rocks.  The line can be long but lucky me, I know the nice man at the front.  It also gets elbow-to-elbow crowded.

Stil, this is the kind of place we like to go for a couple of rounds and some dancing, then hop on the subway and get somewhere cheaper and closer to home for last-call.  It's kinda like a bigger, louder, dirtier, more expensive Trad'r Sam's.  But I still love it.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
The venue itself is nice, but no proper stage for live performers. :( I attended a small live performance of jazz there, and I could tell that the music could easily get very loud.

The drinks were pretty good, Stephanie and Marshall were sweethearts. 

Three stars only because if it wasn't for the live performance, I'm not sure I would've known about the place.
author: dj z.

description:
I can be manly and still like umbrellas in my drinks, right? What about plastic monkeys and seahorses? Citrus fruit slice or a cherry is pushing it though right?

A bunch of WhaleRiders and you'll stop laboring over those judgmental questions.
author: hunter w.

description: One of the stops on St. Patrick's Day...I know, I know...why Bamboo Hut you ask? Because the bartenders are amazing and because of how much fun I had on St. Patty's Day, I'm going to go ahead and say that this has become one of my favorite bars. Plus how can you go wrong with a bag-pipe player in a tiki bar whilst sipping on voodoo juice? You simply can't :)
author: Stephanie C.

description: Definitely not my favorite place in the world.  If it were on Polk street,it would fit, but here in North Beach it feels too dressed down and out of place.  Also they can't mix a drink to save their lives.  Unless by mixing I mean, "pour in a pint of vodka, add a splash of colored water."  'Cause they do that rather well.
author: Mason G.

description:
I have had the pleasure of working with Max and his amazing staff on several occaisions and finally had the opportunity to enjoy their hospitality from the other side!  I celebrated my birthday here last week and could not have been happier with the special attention, the great atmosphere and the friendliness all around.  The DJ, Kirk, was fabulous with requests, many happy birthday wishes and loads of 80's(I grew up on it so have to love it)...not sure if it was the music or the volcano bowls, but he had our whole crew dancing:)  
A special thanks to Tobias for pulling it all together and allowing me be a stress free birthday girl!  Can't wait for another opportunity to throw a  party here:)
author: Carrie P.

description: Nice location. Inexpensive bottle service. I really didn't need it. Music was okay.
author: Val B.

description: Just what you'd expect from a Tiki dive bar.  Pretty low-key on a Thursday.  Probably the best bar I've been to in this neighborhood tho.
author: Nessie V.

description: Freakin Radical! I have been coming to the Hut for several years now. Buuttt im finding myself staggering in here more frequently now. I enjoyed this place before with my ex gf and the old bartenders. now the allure is greater with Mario, Nate, and Chris's hospitality behind the bar. The bucket o' Beer is a safe bet but parties always endulge in the Volcano bowls. The Navy Grog floored me. Its a nice change of pace from the neighboring ghetto clubs and douche bags. One star off cause I dont enjoy the dominant hip hop ipod music. Book your next party here!
author: Alex S.

description:
The place is small, and there's a cover charge for going in Saturday nights ($5), so why would anyone want to come here?
Because of their Flaming Volcano Bowl! It is $16 and in the middle it's a shot of Bacardi 151.  I do not know exactly but I know it's really good, big enough to share with 3, maybe 4 ppl, and if u do split it between 3 or 4 ppl it's pretty cheap. The bartender kept on lighting up the bacardi with his fingers, which i thought was pretty cool.

CONS:
-cover charge, i know it's $5 and that's not much but it's basically a dive bar
-it's a dive bar
-it's small

PROS:
-the drinks are good and relatively cheap
-the music is good
-there is a tiny small (if u can even call that) dance floor
author: Melissa G.

description:
the bar was alright....

we passed by here on friday before going to Horizon (that's across the street) to check this place out...well it wasn't full and the "Volcano Bowl" was alright, i was expecting it to feel some alcohol in it but i didn't, maybe it was just me haha..

-they had sand all over the floor, that was cool never seen that before..and well i dont know maybe another day i'll give this place another chance to see if its really that good...
author: Vale O.

description:
I've been to the bamboo hut a number of times and I have to say it's my kind of place. its what I would call a dive tiki bar... tasty drinks...volcano bowl is a must. A selection of premium and cheap beers. Ask jay for an SOB. mellow environment. A colorful cast of characters who I assume are the regulars. Like a loud and large man that the others refer to as "fat Sam"... But my favorite part time and time again is the music. Usually the bar tenders Mario, jay, Jamie, rocko and Stephanie play from their Ipods...and they truly have great taste. but from time to time they have killer DJs like Aspect from the jazz mafia...saw him there on a Saturday night. There is a couple, a guy and girl (btw chick is a serious hottie) they play oldies on Monday so if you wanna dance to 50s and 60s rock and roll you gotta check them out. its a great low brow place. Won't make you wait long for an elaborate tiki drink and then charge you an arm and a leg. Plus fellas if you're on Broadway looking at the ladies this is the ONLY REGULAR BARon Broadway...and if you're lucky you won't have to pay any women you meet there to touch you...also if you wanna strike up a convo with one of the Broadway bimbos you see in the clubs they take their breaks here.

All in all this place is a hoot so check it out next time your in north beach.
author: Steuart L.

description: Scorpion bowls are sooooo FUN! Have you ever thought about where to go before hitting the club so you will have a REALLY good time. Well this is the place to go before hitting any of the clubs along the red light district. The scorpion bowls are great for groups and will really get you going. The place isn't big but its good enough for small groups. The people here are very lively and have such a good time. They end up dancing and doing weird things since they don't realize how strong these drinks can be. Just a note don't try drinking a whole scorpion bowl by yourself. You'll wake up the next day asking yourself "WHAT HAPPENED LAST NIGHT?!?!". I'm just saying.... but ultimately its your choice. Don't come back and tell me like I didn't warn you!
author: Jonathon C.

description: The Bamboo Hut is a tiki bar located on Broadway at Kearny. One would not assume that a tropical oasis awaits behind it's nondescript entrance. The Bamboo Hut is a place that I would hang out at even if I did not work there.  What makes the Hut so special are those casts of characters we call regulars. We have had a lot of fun whooping it up at the Hut. Every weekend our DJ's will get you to dance and sing along to the hits of the 80's and 90's. Every third Thursday is Rockin Like Dokken a night devoted to 80's rock and metal. There is also a ridiculously great happy hour every Thursday and Friday (5pm-8pm) with half priced Tiki Drinks and $3.00 Red Stripes.  Make sure to have your next party at the Bamboo Hut. We specialize in private parties as well as accommodating large groups.  Next time you find yourself in Northbeach make sure to drop by the Hut! Ma halo!
author: Tobias H.

description: Cool place, drinks, and bartenders.  The sand and the leis were a delight for their themed beach party.  I enjoyed the atmosphere, including the bumpin' music from the 80s & 90s.  Their flaming tiki volcano drink seemed a lil weak, despite sharing what was supposed to be a four person drink with only one other person (and then some, when we indulged with a few anonymous drinkers who had let us take a drink from their own volcano).  But a few more drinks solved that problem, my soberness, waning.  The patrons there were a complete trip.  It sure beat staying home on a Friday night.  I'll be back soon enough.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
bamboo hut is bumpin'. came here recently to check out a local band on a wednesday night. it was very chill, which is very much my speed. quite enjoyable with nice friendly bar staff and a good fun crowd. at least on that weeknight.

other nights are a different story, but still bumpin'. as in watch out for the people bumpin' into you. this is the story of one fun night turned sour (and chunky).

a fairly large group of us headed over to bamboo hut after work a while back. and i was chatting up some folks, having a jolly good time, until some big middle-aged oaf stumbled drunkenly right beside me and splashed his drink on my shoulder. rude!! so i turned around to see who it was and why everyone had cleared the floor around me. (stop reading now if you're eating. i'm serious.) it wasn't his drink that he splashed on me. instead, he yakked all over my shoulder and my arm and my back and my leg. yum, indeed. i stood in my spot for at least five seconds, shocked and disgusted and dumbfounded as to whether to punch the oaf in the face or hose myself off. luckily, one of my friends whisked me to the restroom in the back and helped clean off as much as possible.

and by the time we were done cleaning, all our friends had headed over to another nearby bar. and by then, the oaf was stumbling over himself on the sidewalk, so good thing bamboo hut didn't let him stay inside.

i tried to be a trooper, but it just didn't work. nobody wanted to dance with the girl who smelled like vomit. so it was time to call it a night. fun!
author: spiff e.

description: After reading some good reviews I wanted a Volcanoe, I went 2 Da Hut right after work around 6 it was pretty much dead whiich was kinda weird cuz it was a Friday... Oh well more Volcanoes for me and the bartender (I forget her name) was real sweet. Happy Hour they got $12 Volcanoes $4 Tropical Mix drinks and $2 beers. Overall it was great place to go, but next time I'll come a bit later cuz those Volcanoes ain't nothing 2 play with.
author: Angelisimo G.

description:
ya know i had never been to this place before new years, but i must say the place is pretty chill. it's on the small side for sure - but the scorpion bowls are pretty unbelievable. as is the giant face which reminds me of "old mac" from legends of the hidden temple (don't lie, you remember that show).

I'd go back for sure. Excellent New Years setup as well.
author: David D.

description: I'm not really into North Beach. Mostly, because of the crowds and teenage punks who look at me like they are going to stab me and take my purse. But my BFF's brother Sam occasionally spins at Bamboo Hut and a crew of about 20 usually end up kicking it at the hut. We were there this past Saturday and had a great time. Drinks are so strong and about a dollar and yes after a handful of what ever your poison is definitely order a volcano. The simple fact that something is on fire is just enough reason for me to want to order one. Additionally, it's one of those places were there are no dress codes, attitudes and not a whole bunch of rules. Oh, and did I mention that you can sit for free? Not bad now that we live in the world of bottle service.  Great place to hang out with friends and have a chill night.
author: Jazzelyn F.

description: Right after I moved back to SF after living in the LA area for almost four years, this is where my friends took me.  It was a small place and we got there a bit early so we took over the back section that was kind of like a private booth.  Perfect since there were about 10+ of us there. As the night went on, the place got more and more crowded.  It was an eclectic mix of older and younger folks.  The music was alright.  The drinks were good.  I remember that the bartender said we used up all their glasses.  That was funny.  All in all, I had a good time.  There wasn't much dancing but I enjoyed just hanging out there with friends.
author: Jillian J.

description:
The best place on broadway to have some goodtimes. I think the weekends here are great fun, good people, quick/funny/good looking bartenders.  The cover is ONLY $5(weekends only), and it's well worth it. Especially, if you're going out to have a couple drinks and dance to the DJs. It definately rocks.  I've been here on the weekdays, it's a chill place to hang out.  It's definately the time to bring a group of friends down and chat, time to chat with the bartenders and regulars.  The music is a little different then weekends.  There is more indie/punk/upcoming bands played.. which I love to listen too.

I went down a couple times last week.  And on Wednesday, they had a band playing and Mondays are 'drunken fiesta' with nachos and beer specials. fantastic for getting through the work week.

Alright, and that's about all I've got to say about this bar.  It's a great change of pace, good fun, good looking people, low cover charge, tasty drinks, and the broadway brown... for all you whiskey drinkers =)

You should all try it out. It's good to have small neighborhood bar during the weekdays and fun party on the weekend. Of course, you can always make it a party on the weekdays.
author: J K.

description: Birthday party at Tiki Bar? Sure why not.  Cool part of it was that general public was not allowed in before 10...so we got to have the place to ourselves for sometime.  I enjoyed a couple of the "Voodoo juices", my only complaint about them was that they were a little weak.  Or maybe I'm just drinking too much....no they were a little weak with the booze.  Anyway, bartenders were extremely nice and gave great service.  Now for the crowd, well it appeared to be very bridge and tunnel once the bar opened up at 10.  Which is OK sometimes, but didn't exactly make me go "Wow I want to go back to this bar!".  I probably will, but it's not super high on the list.  Fun concept.
author: Amanda P.

description: You will have fun at The Hut, a.k.a The Banana Hammock.  Marshall and if you're extra lucky, Steve or Nick White will make sure of that.
author: Jeffery S.

description:
When we first stepped into this place, I thought it was big.. until I realized that was the mirror!  It is a tiny place, cutely decorated and decent for a bar.  However, we didn't see too many people dancing so we left!  The music wasn't so great to me, but of course YMMV.  Unfortunately, the tiny (and I mean tiny) dance area is right under the huge speakers so it was absolutely deafening!  Alas, the earplugs didn't work out.

The staff was friendly and the crowd seemed decent, but just not my cup of tea.  On the way home we asked our cab driver for a recommendation.  Trying to be cool, he suggested the strip club down the street.  UM, no thanks!  Be warned.  This is in a mini red light district!
author: Nishka B.

description: Rockin like dokken on the third thursday of every month. With classics like Def Lepard, Guns N Roses, AC/DC, Whitesnake, how can you possibly go wrong. Add to that the ultimate party girl who can drink anybody under the table, and take years off your life in a matter of hours, and you have my thursday evenings at the Bamboo Hut. We should make this a regular event for Yelpers.  Max, you da man.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
If you aren't:

A. Right out of college
B. With a bachelorette party

You're going to hate it!   

I still can't decide which is cheesier (or dirtier for that matter) the clientele or the decor.  Oh I almost forgot to mention - my friend got her purse stolen there (I'll admit it was naive for her to put her purse down with her coat but still.)
author: AngelaS F.

description: I give it 4 stars only cuz we had a ton of fun there probably because of my crazy coworkers and the drunkards we met there. lol Anyways this is probably the most useless review I've ever written.
author: Hyung L.

description: Overrated. fun with friends but it's hella small so make sure you can breathe. Try the volcano, its worth trying once. I guess if you like bars this is more like that since the drinks are good. Bonus: its on broadway Caution: volcano is on fire
author: Jim L.

description: He made me the pretty drink here last night.  I had a cherry, seahorse and an umbrella in it.  What was I drinking do not ask as I do not know.  I just asked for a fruity drink....my stomach was kinda queasy after 2 patrons at another bar.  A shot of Jameson here cured my queasiness but I really wasn't in the mood for another one.  So the drink did me just right.  My gf order a lava flow.....mmm delicious it was.  Tasted very much like a creamsicle...at least to me that was.  A very nice place to hang out at when you can just sit there and hang out with the awesome bartender....I am definitely going to come back again for drinks.
author: Allison T.

description: This place is a slice of heaven. Great bartenders, kitchy atmosphere, and well made drinks. Some of the drinks are loaded up with tropical frou-frou decorations and the music played there is unlike anything you will find on broadway. The bamboo hut is my favorite bar in north beach.
author: Charise B.

description: Did i go on an off nite?  The place was just kinda empty than what I remember it to ever be. Hmm....Maybe.  But it was awesome to watch the older Asian lady with the hot-ass bod prance around with various men.  You could tell she was at the gym earlier that day thinkin:"You know?  I think I just wanna dance tonite!  I'm gonna wear my teeny weeny black dress tonite and just dance!"  Tenders were cool. People were ghetto. Music was pretty good, especially when the dj rocked a Journey mashup.  Cause...I'M JUST A SMALL TOWN GIRL, LIVIN IN A LONELY WORLD y'all. Fuckin rocked! Go there for a surreally cheezi experience.
author: Joyhan S.

description: Lets put it this way.... I had my 25th birthday party here! I frickin LOOOOVE this bar! Nick, Marshall and Lauren are amazing! they know what they are doing and they know how to show you a good time! If the bar is dead or alive, you always have a great time here! Highly recommended! Great atmosphere and cute setting! all in all the bartenders make this bar!
author: Kelley A.

description: Love, love, love this dive bar. Not only do they have a plethora of yummy umbrella type drinks, but the music be pumpin'. I've been there when bachlorette parties roll through with their caca-maney dares. SF scavenger hunts and of course the ugly tiki vintage shirt weareres can't fit anywhere better than The Bamboo Hut.  Good times, an amazing variety of people, andgenerous servings of spirits. When you roll through give a nod to Mario the bartender he'll take care of you!
author: Jada M.

description: I get the tropical theme. I get the tropical drinks. I just can't stop the feeling where I have been warped back to high school spring break in Cancun. I can't quite put my finger on why I get this feeling, but I may never be back to figure it out.
author: Alicia J.

description: The volcano drinks were cool; the one-staller women's bathroom wasn't.  And I agree with Audrey K. about the DJ... pick a genre/time period and be confident in it!  Prince's "Rasberry Beret" is an awesome song (which I love) but it ruins my groove to be dancing to that and then some crappy techno song I'd never heard of next.    A for effort with the interesting bar theme but otherwise not worth the $10 cab fare.
author: Kate M.

description: The place is small, dim and it can get crowded and there is definitely limited seating, but all in all this place is still a good time. They play some pretty good tunes too (I think there are different themes on depending on the day of the week). Drinks are pretty good, and prices are pretty decent as well.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I've gone here like 2-3 times. It's a nice chill place to get ready for the other clubs on this street. I haven't gone here in a while. Definitely will make a stop when I'm around.
author: Joanne D.

description: i love coming here!! if it isn't packed with the odd crowd that is sometimes found here and we get a table its a great time! we share the flaming volcano bowl and enjoy the decor (over the top tiki theme) which sometimes can just be what you need to start a fun night! The negatives are that the bathrooms have been disgusting more then once and sometimes the crowd can be a little annoying.. just get there early enough for a table and you will be fine ;) the bar tenders are always super nice to which helps!
author: Barbara C.

description: All I'm going to say is ummmm, tasty drinks...get the giant one to share!
author: Cassy R.

description: My current favorite bar in San Francisco.  All the bartenders are super nice, friendly, and hot.  Filled with friendly people and a "come hang with the locals" atmosphere. And when Steve the bartender is in charge of the music selection it is AMAZING.  You'll find me and plenty of my cute girlfriends at this bar on a weekly basis. Take a photo in the photo booth and send it to the Bamboo Hut's myspace page at http://www.myspace.com/sfbamboohut and you will be immortalized in their hall of fame. Oh, and sometimes they fill the floor of the bar with sand and have an indoor beach party. Seriously. WAY too much fun.
author: Sivan B.

description: The bartenders here are awesome! Get to know Lauren - she'll take care of you! She caters to your taste and always whips something up she senses you'll like.  Make sure to get there after 10:30pm or else you'll find you and your friends are the only ones there.
author: Mellie P.

description:
Went here last night after getting some pizza in North Beach. I hadn't expected much from a place that looked so freakishly Hawaiian trendy but actually ended up loving it and will undoubtedly return. 

First, we were there at happy hour, which meant that our 5 mix drinks and 2 shooters came out to $27. That's pretty damn sweet. 

Mix drinks: I had the cabana cooler, my friend had the tipsy turtle. Both delicious and deceptively tasty but quite strong. 
Shooters: I had something with razzberry rum, OJ, and cranberry, and he had the shark attack. Shooters is a very innocent word for what were essentially scotch glasses filled with shooter drinks. Gigantic and tasty!
The place itself was not too crowded and lively, it was early in the evening still. 

My only issue was with the fact that the bartender partook in one helluva fucked up conversation with the girls next to us that made me really wanna spit in his face and call him a fuckass, but since he nice to us and probably didn't realize that he came off as an antisemitic douchebag I just hated him on the inside instead. But since this is an issue of personal stupidity and not related to the bar it's not really gonna bring it down. Let's just say that the bartender with the mohawk is an ass.
author: Tatyana D.

description:
It had been a while since I had visited the Bamboo Hut. We showed up to the ast night, not realizing that it was a Beach Party Weekend, so the entire bar was covered with sand! How fun! 

We were handed flip-flops and proceeded to the bar, where the female bartender was great!

We had a group of 10+ people and took over the nook in the back, which was perfect!

The music was great and the crowd was cool! Drinks are strong - try their flaming volcano bowl.
author: Pam W.

description: really cool divey place. you can still go ahead and dance though, if you feel the need.
author: Kristen S.

description: Tiki Bar? I'm in! Tiki Dive Bar? Let me think about it... okay. So if you bring your own group, it can be a fun place, but it's not the type of place I'd go by my lonesome or just with a girl-friend. The happy hour is til 8 and kind of amazing, though. Sure it's low-key, but fruity drinks for $4 and $3 red stripes?! complete with coconut cups and umbrellas. Mai Tai is good. Have had the thing set on fire in a group - fun. It's cute, but yes, still a dive bar.
author: Angela H.

description:
I've had some good itmes here. It's a super fun place--come on, it's tiki themed.

The bartenders are awesome. The music is good. The crowd is mostly chill and totally unpretentious.

It kind of reminds me of the Tonga Room, but way smaller, less touristy and less expensive.
author: Nicole R.

description: Best bar on Broadway and best bar-staff, too! They don't tolerate dumbasses, which is a nice change of pace in North Beach. Be sure to check out some of their kickass vintage music nights --Rockin'!
author: Jim S.

description: Great bar, good music and some space to dance, cool people hanging out.... They have a great happy hourdeal and the flaming vulcano drink is fun and original. Loved this place!
author: Marie-Line V.

description:
cost 5 bucks to get in.  

which was not bad but the crowd was mostly dudes when i got in there.  The girl i was with was like only 1 of 10 girls out maybe 30 guys.  

drinks were good but i may pass next time.  unless i need a drink with 151 lit in the middle of it.
author: douglas b.

description: i came here on 2 separate saturday nights. the first time it was slow and almost no one else in there. the second time it was insanely packed. tucked away in its own little world between the titty bars was this refreshing dive. got the volcano bowls. awesome deal. on the slow night it was decorated with plastic monkey and umbrellas. on the busy night it was just the drink and the flaming 151. worth checking out if youre in the area
author: nick w.

description: I had a lot of fun here last night with some friends.  We were just going to make it another quick stop, but it ended up being the stop.  The music was really fun and the bartenders were great (perhaps because my friends got them shots on my tab...ah crap).  There were a lot of fun and attractive people there and the drinks weren't too expensive (although a little strong, but I can't complain about that now can I...?).  Tip:  Don't let your friends and the bartender decide that your card will be everyone's tab for the night just because you're new...Really fun place, but I think the bartender screwed us with our tabs in the end.
author: Nate V.

description: Awesome drinks. Good throwback music. This is a good place to go with a group of Hawaii-obsessed friends who always make me feel weird because I didn't arrive wearing a Hawaiian shirt. The crowd is fairly cool. But I caution you to take it easy with the drinks, they are sneakily strong.
author: Jen A.

description: Came here one late night to meet up some friend from State. Clean venue and friendly bartenders. The flaming volcano bowl is a must try.
author: crystal e.

description:
Clearly you need to get the volcano bowl, icy/rummy/flaming ridiculousness guaranteed to have you on the sandy floor.

How to attain one, however, was my challenge of the evening.

Not having breasts to flaunt or the burly or jock persona necessary to buddy it up with our bartender in testosterone backed camaraderie, this skinny fag had to enlist the attention grabbing tatas of one of his hags to lure our bartender over to fan the flames of my faggotry with none other than a flaming booze volcano.

Once we had drink in hand, the night was pretty good.  Our DJ of the night, aside from ignoring requests, played fairly decent music.  The floor was like a giant sand box and they gave us free flip-flops, which made for some interesting times.  A few volcano bowls later we danced across the sand and made our grand exit.

It all worked out in the end: recalling the carnal look of the bartender as he objectified my friend was just what I needed to enduce the at home vomiting spree that saved me from what could have been a hangover most murderous!

Next time though, I think I'll stick to Trader Sams for my tiki bar bowl of ice blended booze needs.
author: Christophe B.

description: Not good or bad.  Kinda divey but I remember having a good ass time here the first time I came.  Second time not as much.  Maybe it was the crowd I was with.  The music is my style - aka anything you would ever here on 99.7 Movin'.  The clientele leaves something to be desired.  Most of the guys there looked like they wanted to latch on to your ass and dry hump you but couldn't quite make it to that level of audacity.  However just staring doesn't make it that much better.
author: Alexis B.

description: It must have been a bad night but I swear there were 10 people in here at 12 am on a Saturday...WTF? Walked in, walked out...lost $5 on the cover :-(
author: Jess W.

description: Small spot, not much goin on inside.  However it is, a getaway from the corny people outside on broadway.
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description: Stopped in here while on a random drive to SF. Small, fun place with yummy $5 shots. Good music.
author: kati m.

description: I love this bar! The crowd is kinda random but it is decorated so cute! Ive been here twice and will definitely come back. The bar tenders are great and the bouncers are really cool people. Saturday night's music was perfect for me. There was a lack of people when I was here due to the holiday weekend but the staff made it worth coming back to :) I like this place better than any other place in north beach.
author: Its a S.

description: Very cool place to grab a  few drinks in a nice setting. The bartenders are friendly and definitely great mixologists. Yes, this place does have quite a bit of tourists but then again isn't that what sf is all about.  A great way to either start or finish your weekend, will try and visit  this place again the next time i am in the area.
author: Raj K.
