description: Super fun place to go! I heart the Flaming Bowl of Liquid! Rundown tiki bar that has a lot to offer. Great music, fun bartender and huge bottles of Red Stripe. Fun place mix up the night life!
author: Megan M.

description: This a is a cool (deceivingly small...thanks to all the mirrors) place in the North Beach area. They make pretty good drinks...one I saw looked like a Scorpion Bowl except that this time, they fired up the center of the bowl which is pretty frikkin awesome...especially if you are already intoxicated; something about that neon blue flame color attracts your eyes like a moth to a flame. The decor is what you would find at other tiki bars. Overall, a great place to hang out and chill with some friends
author: Joel V.

description: You gotta be in the right mood for this place, but when you are, you can expect a ridiculously good time.  My friends and I love the cheesy atmosphere and always go here when we want guaranteed fun on a girls' night out.  I like the unpretentious, un-scene-y nature, and the fact that they play the feel good hits you like to dance to (hel-LO "Safety Dance!!" --- at least that's what I want to dance to!) without being totally annoying.  I was disappointed on a recent Saturday night, however, when they were charging a $5 cover and the place was so damned crowded that we gave up after trying to order a drink for 15 minutes.  Luckily the guy at the door was very chill and gave us our money back.
author: Emma K.

description: Horrible sound system. Drink names like Bali Bomb should have clued us in the calbre of this place. We lasted 10 minutes.
author: Geordie E.

description: Best bar to watch newbie alkies try to compete on the weekend. The bartenders and regulars make the scene.... And watch out for those volcanoes, I have seen many eruptions because of those things..... Peace
author: francisco M.

description: Good music and cheap drinks made pretty ok. The DJ needs a tune-up though and a lesson in mixing.
author: Charm N.

description: For being on broadway this place is pretty crackin. Loved the hurricane I had (this was way back). Went on a Friday in the middle of the summer, better for the happy hours and off days of the week, but still, a great find in the city.
author: Niki M.

description: Been here a few times.. Love the decor. Bartenders make good drinks.. This is a place you can go to anytime of the week.. And yes i have been there on week nights.
author: Alfredo N.

description: This is your Average place, but hey its a dive bar.  I'd suggest something a little grander, more elegant if you're interested in this Hawaiian Motif.
author: John B.

description: this place is cool...went there on a weeknight and the dj was playing good hip hop...the crowd was laid back and the bartenders were cool. cant beat the $3 pbr's.
author: Ulysses B.

description: I've been here once, and already love it.  It's a change from the typical bar.  It's themed, the drinks are at a great price, and the music played that night was mostly 80's n 90's, rock.  Great place to just chill, relax, or even dance just a little.  Located in an area of lots of strip clubs, you never would have thought to find this place.
author: Christi S.

description: Tiki Bar in SF...never thought it was possible.  But can you turn away from a rockin' thur night w/ a HOT harley literally inside the bar?  Good times baby, good times!
author: Wendy H.

description: This place does not do it for me.  If you like dive's but your friends insist on being on Broadway, then this is the place since Crow Bar closed.  The Tiki theme does not work,  the beat up decor and nasty floor just seem like bums hang out there.
author: Christian W.

description: Great place to hang out with friends. My girls and I made the entrence way a dance floor. Awesome music, good drinks, friendly staff. Cheap cover (5 bucks) Dance floor should be bigger though...
author: Mary B.

description: It's always ok in here.  I like to come here before hitting the busier bars on Broadway to chill and talk a bit while getting warmed up with cheaper drinks here then at most other broadway spots.
author: Medwin M.

description: This place was fun, from what I remember, since we were drunk when we got there.  However I don't ever remember being groped that much in a bar!  I don't know what they serve in those giant flaming bowls but it sure is tasty!
author: Kirsten M.

description: I hate to write this place off, but I just didn't think it was worth the trip from the Richmond to North Beach (taking two buses mind you). Maybe it's just because I went at 9:30 in the pouring rain, but I wasn't that impressed.  The decor is nice though (I especially like the HUGE glowing tiki mask on the wall).  Maybe I'll give this place another try.
author: Allison K.

description: DO NOT GO. Nasty aggressive staff. I was shocked to see a customer physically assaulted by a very large bartender for no reason. I won't be returning and wouldn't advise it. If I could give a zero rating..
author: James K.

description: The staff is really friendly and you can always see some regular faces in there. Good music, good drinks, and good people make this my 'old faithful' place to go on the weekends.
author: Anne-Marie H.

description: Rock and Roll, Jameson, and cold beer, oh yeah sexy bartenders too.
author: Josiah B.

description: Came here during a bachelorette party bar hop. First of all, Tiki stuff annoys me. I hate when people take beautiful indigenous art and use it for their own undereducated amusement. This is a great place to come if you like to get hit on by sleazy guys on the lookout for the drunkest chick to hit on.
author: Laura S.

description: good drinks. GREAT DJ. does anyone know who the DJ is that does the mashups? He was there the Saturday I was there.
author: Joe R.

description:
I went to this bar after a long walk craving a cold beer. What I received was a room temperature beer. The bartender made no attempt to rectify the situation; we left, leaving no tip.

You can imagine how surprised I was when I checked my bank records and discovered that the bartender had decided to give himself a $10 tip, on a $14 bill. That bartender better pray he never runs into me again, just as I pray I'll never run into Bamboo Hut again.
author: Jack R.

description: sand on the floor and tiki.  went on a friend's recommendation and this place did not disappoint.  fun, cool, laid back people.  great bartenders.  it's a dive bar with sand!
author: John C.

description:
lo-rent version of trader vics/tonga room.  great if you like dive bars (i do), but i have two not so great memories of this place...

i stumbled into this place late one night with friends after trying out a few other places along broadway.  the very friendly doorman waved me and my friends in without the cover charge (seriously, a cover charge for this dump???).  thank god, cuz i had to pee...not just a little tinkle, i needed to pee like a racehorse.  you may be wondering why i feel compelled to share this with you - here's why: because the best thing about this place was that i headed straight to the bathroom and it was empty!  i mean, how often does that happen?  crowded bar on a friday night, you gotta pee something fierce and there's no line?  so i rush in, close the door and gingerly do my precarious squat balancing act on 4 inch stilletos, ass delicately positioned over the bowl and just as i'm doing my business, some guy opens the door!  not such a big deal, but he just stands there and watches me.  althought i am normally a very modest person, i don't bat an eyelash - i mean, i'm mid-stream of a drunk pee (which goes on forever) so i just i hold my precarious position, stare him straight in the eye and say "if you keep standing there, you're gonna need to buy me a drink".
 
he laughs, closes the door and i finish up. of course he's parked himself right outside...so i collect on my drink.  as ugly guy is ordering  i look around and realize the place is vaguely familiar...i think i've been here before.  he turns around and proffers the drink i realize where i am.  this is the the stinky coconut place!  i'd been there a few months before to meet friends for drinks.  as i sipped on my tropical concotion served in the requisite coconut cup,  an offensive odor hits me...i continue to sip and wonder who stepped in shit.  ugh, the funk hangs in the air, i can't figure out where it's coming from.  as i slurp up the last of my toxic drink i realize where the stink is coming from...the bottom of the coconut cup.  it smells like ass.  i'm sure it's got some crazy mold thing growing in it, but of course it's too dark to see. i complain to the bartender, but they don't seem too interested, at which point i start walking around and  asking other people if i can sniff their coconut cup.  this of course doesn't make the bartender happy - but it did finally get me my free drink - in a REAL glass.  

so - 4 stars to bamboo hut for being a dive, but minus one for doors that don't close properly and for stinky coconuts.
author: Jennifer G.

description: something wild and crazy about this casual little tiki bar. good tunes usually playing, good drink specials and a low-key crowd. i've had some very fun times at this place. its a very nice break from all the "i'm trying to be so cool and trendy" lounges on broadway.
author: Michelle I.

description: You walk in on what appears to be the set of LOST. It's Tiki Central there, complete with the tropical drinks, "wid a widdow umbwewa."  If you rely on the theme to pop you out of where you are (North Beach) instead of looking for faux tropical escapism, you won't be disappointed. The crowds can vary as well. You either get the weekend invasion crowd just looking to do some SERIOUS damage to the interior of their Noggins, Leaving Las Vegas style, "I think I'll name my first born after Superman's dad;" or you get the worker bees that wanna bust lose on a bad weekday night. I walked in on a quarterly trivia night fund raiser that's held by Community Educational Services and the China Town Beacon Center. Hella Fun...and it's for kids (awwww!) But seriously, I hope they hold trivia night there quarterly. Created a fun, lively atmosphere complete with fun bartender that knew the names of the original Charlie's Angels (CHA! Jill, Sabrina & Kelly..BU-YA!).... So the Bamboo Hut's the place if you're in the mood for lighthearted fun and strong, strong ..um ... beverages.
author: Johnny C.

description: i can't believe lauren shilled her own bar!?!  kool bar, kool door guys, kool bartenders, kool 80's retro dj's, & kool foo foo drinks...well not really but that's not my cup of tea.
author: Pickle R.

description: The flaming scorpion bowl/ volcano or whatever it is called provides so much entertainment! I love wondering in here for a drink...usually after a few bars. I wouldn't spend the entire night here, though. The crowd seems to be a lot of out-of-towners and the bartender is not very nice. Still it's fun to dance around in the sand.
author: Amy C.

description: My sister's fiance made the mistake of having his bachelor party at a club which charged $550 for two VIP tables, and the service was horrible. My husband took the opportunity to introduce them to Bamboo Hut.  All of the guys agreed that the Bamboo Hut was the bar where they had the best time.  The bartenders and staff are very friendly.  The drinks are great and you never have to wait around to get another.  Oh and did I mention the price?  Compared to the quality and size of the drinks you feel like you are getting a great deal.  It's a great bar for a girls, guys or couples night out.
author: Michelle W.

description: if you're looking for a place that makes you feel like you're on an episode of 'lost', the 'bamboo hut' is your stop!
author: Steven K.

description:
I went to this Bar after our Christmas Party in the City. All of us were dressed up pretty nice and we wanted a pretty cool place to chill. After reading the reviews here on yelp, a co worker and I thought that this place would be seriously amazing! All of the reviews said that they had the time of our lives.
Well let me be honest-when you see the picture of this place it looks so much bigger than it really is. There are two booths in the whole place and a lot of standing room. The DJ is right on the floor in a little cubby hole playing music out of speakers that you stand right next to. You also have to pay a five dollar cover charge...I didnt really like the place. The only good thing about Bamboo Hut is that the drinks were strong and we got one for free. Other than that, I will not go back there. It is also in the middle of the strip clubs and not that nice. Dont go there unless you are dressed down, wanting to stand around...and willing to pay a cover charge.
author: caroline k.

description: bamboo hut was quite the focal point of our unofficial "hooray for alcoholism" pub crawl.  we stopped here for a quick shot, and after a few more bars decided this was where we'd spend the rest of our night.  from that point on it was crown royal bombs all night (which were surprisingly good).  fun tiki theme, good musaks, and the bartender was willing to put up with shit from a crew full of boozers (being us).  thank you mystery bartender... it saddens me to not know your name.
author: Sean L.

description: ok. so it doesn't rain in here, and the natives are often suspiciously blond, but after a couple of the bootleg rum Mai Tai's you won't care.
author: Stellah D.

description: really enjoyed the place - a fun atmosphere, and definitely one of the better designed tiki bars out there. the cover is definitely reasonable, and the staff is super friendly (the bartenders always say 'thank you'!) a nice change of pace from the other north beach bars out there. nice selection of music also, although i must say the dj is sometimes not without flaws.
author: Jon N.

description: One of the best happy hours in North beach, Love the blended  strong fruity drinks in fake coconuts.... downside being that it's only available Thursdays and Fridays....
author: Joy Y.

description: third thursday of the month: rockin' like dokken. done.
author: Dean E.

description: i was so drunk when i got here but i remember having a rad time... the music was cool...
author: Rhea F.

description: popped in here for a few minutes to grab a drink while we waited for Horizon across the street to open. relaxed atmosphere and GOOD old school 90's music- they got me at the music.
author: Mrs. P.

description: this is a FUN place to get wasted!!  the first time i went, my girlfriend and i split a "volcano bowl" which was a HUGE bowl of frozen yumminess with a flame in the middle!!  it was enough to get 4 people smashed...and it was only $16!!  the bartender is super friendly and the music (which was 70's, 80's, and 90's music) kept getting better and better as the night went on!  the second time at bamboo hut was in the middle of the week and they had some lame 50's music crap playing, but i still had a good time.  it's a cute place that's cozy and fun, and for some reason at the end of the night, my tab is always a lot LESS than i thought it would be!  if you go to bamboo hut, get a volcano bowl and (if you can handle any more alcohol) a bali shot!  mmmmmm!!
author: Meg H.

description: kind of reminds me of the sigma chi cowabunga party from my college days.  bamboo everywhere!  the dj was fun and the bartenders were cool.  a good warm up for the dragon bar.
author: M D.

description: i never been to hawaii but the decor kinda makes me imagine what it's like in some hotel bar in hawaii. anyways all sorts of tropical drinks if your into that sort of thing. the weekends area little to much for me. i been known to make an appearance early in the week(mon/tue) not to much going on. no dj just a ipod and a stereo system. the staff is great so tip well and ask if you can put your ipod in the mix.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
